########################################################################
#    Joerg Schilling = mkisofs: A program to create hybrid ISO9660/Joliet/HFS filesystems with optional Rock Ridge attributes
########################################################################
http://cdrtools.sourceforge.net/private/man/cdrtools-3.01axx/mkisofs.8.html


mkisofs
########################################################################
donald@LatitudeE4200:/tmp$ mkisofs
mkisofs: Missing pathspec.
Usage: mkisofs [options] [-find] file... [find expression]

Use mkisofs -help
to get a list all of valid options.

Use mkisofs -find -help
to get a list of all valid -find options.

Most important Options:
    -posix-H        Follow sylinks encountered on command line
    -posix-L        Follow all symlinks
    -posix-P        Do not follow symlinks (default)
    -o FILE, -output FILE    Set output file name
    -R, -rock        Generate Rock Ridge directory information
    -r, -rational-rock    Generate rationalized Rock Ridge directory info
    -J, -joliet        Generate Joliet directory information
    -print-size        Print estimated filesystem size and exit
    -UDF            Generate UDF file system
    -dvd-audio        Generate DVD-Audio compliant UDF file system
    -dvd-video        Generate DVD-Video compliant UDF file system
    -dvd-hybrid        Generate a hybrid (DVD-Audio/DVD-Video) compliant UDF file system
    -iso-level LEVEL    Set ISO9660 level (1..3) or 4 for ISO9660 v 2
    -V ID, -volid ID    Set Volume ID
    -graft-points        Allow to use graft points for filenames
    -M FILE, -prev-session FILE    Set path to previous session to merge








########################################################################
#    Joerg Schilling = cdrecord-prodvd-2.01-pre-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
########################################################################
https://sourceforge.net/projects/cdrtools/files/alpha/OLD/


wget http://ufpr.dl.sourceforge.net/project/cdrtools/ProDVD/OLD/cdrecord-prodvd-2.01-pre-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu













Back to Top...
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    cdrdao - almost exact copy of the audio CD. - BackUp Audio CD - CDDA backup - audio2iso - audio2bin  - audiocd2iso - audiocd2bin - cdda2iso - cdda2toc
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://sourceforge.net/projects/cdrdao/

No ISO format possible od CD-DA as Audio CD has no files sytem.
Audio CDs contain uncompressed lossless audio, which takes up a lot of space on the disk but is very good quality.
The format for this is stereo audio in 44100Hz 16-bit PCM WAV format.

http://www.andrews-corner.org/burning.html
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/cdrdao
https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Optical_Disc_Drive


https://help.ubuntu.com/community/cdrdao
http://www.yolinux.com/TUTORIALS/LinuxTutorialCDBurn.html
https://www.ocf.berkeley.edu/~reinholz/freebsd/command_line_burning.html#audio_copy
http://www.andrews-corner.org/burning.html#audio
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/cdrdao



cdrdao - https://packages.debian.org/jessie/cdrdao - records CDs in Disk-At-Once (DAO) mode -
cdparanoia - https://packages.debian.org/jessie/cdparanoia - audio extraction tool for sampling CDs
bashburn - https://packages.debian.org/jessie/bashburn - simplify cd/dvd burning at the command line
abcde - https://packages.debian.org/jessie/abcde - A Better CD Encoder

icedax - https://packages.debian.org/jessie/icedax - Creates WAV files from audio CDs
yaret - https://packages.debian.org/jessie/yaret - A console tool to turn CDs into encoded music


#1 Install neceserry tools
sudo apt-get install cdrdao cdparanoia bashburn abcde -y
sudo apt-get install icedax yaret  # Don't install if you want or have installed cdrtools 3.02~a06-1 (cdrecord, cdda2wav, mkisofs)


#2 Check the CD Drive
sudo cdrdao scanbus


#3 RIP the CD
cdrdao read-cd --source-device /dev/scd0 --driver generic-mmc --paranoia-mode 3 audiocd.toc
cdrdao read-cd --source-device 1,0,0 --driver generic-mmc --paranoia-mode 3 audiocd.toc

cdrdao read-cd --read-raw --datafile [filename.bin] --device [bus,id,lun] --driver generic-mmc-raw [filename.toc]

cdrdao read-cd --read-raw --source-device /dev/scd0 --driver generic-mmc-raw --datafile TEAM.Zlate.Hity.bin --paranoia-mode 3 TEAM.Zlate.Hity.toc
cdrdao read-cd --read-raw --source-device /dev/scd1 --driver generic-mmc-raw --datafile TEAM.Zlate.Hity.bin --paranoia-mode 3 TEAM.Zlate.Hity.toc
cdrdao read-cd --read-raw --source-device /dev/sr1 --driver generic-mmc-raw --datafile TEAM.Zlate.Hity.bin --paranoia-mode 3 TEAM.Zlate.Hity.toc
cdrdao read-cd --read-raw --source-device 1,0,0 --driver generic-mmc-raw --datafile TEAM.Zlate.Hity.bin --paranoia-mode 3 TEAM.Zlate.Hity.toc


#4 Create checksum of the CD-DA Disc - NOT WORKING!
sha512sum /dev/sr0 | awk '{print $1}' > TEAM.Zlate.Hity.CD.sha512sum

#NOTES
sudo lshw -class disk
getfacl /dev/sr0
http://forensicswiki.org/wiki/Ddrescue#Installation
sudo apt-get install gddrescue
ddrescue -b 2048 /dev/cdrom cdimage logfile
md5sum /dev/cdrom
dd if=/dev/sr0 bs=2048 count=356352 | md5sum


#5 Create checksum of the created BIN file - change "TEAM.Zlate.Hity.bin"
sha512sum TEAM.Zlate.Hity.bin | awk '{print $1}' > TEAM.Zlate.Hity.bin.sha512sum


#6 Check the integrity of both the CD and Image - - NOT WORKING! as can not create checksum of CD-DA disc
diff -qs TEAM.Zlate.Hity.CD.sha512sum TEAM.Zlate.Hity.bin.sha512sum


#7 Convert with DD
dd conv=swab if=TEAM.Zlate.Hity.bin of=TEAM.Zlate.Hity.swab.bin


#8 Replcae *.bin with *.swab.bin
mv TEAM.Zlate.Hity.bin TEAM.Zlate.Hity.raw.bin
mv TEAM.Zlate.Hity.swab.bin TEAM.Zlate.Hity.bin




#7 Burn the *.bin / *.cue
sudo cdrdao write -v 2 --speed 12 --device 0,5,0 --eject *.cue
sudo cdrdao write --device /dev/sr0 image.cue


# TOC/CUE/BIN for mixed-mode disks
sudo cdrdao read-cd --read-raw --datafile image.bin --driver generic-mmc:0x20000 --device /dev/cdrom image.toc


# Some software only likes CUE/BIN pair, you can make a CUE sheet with toc2cue (part of cdrdao):
toc2cue image.toc image.cue





# Yet another Ripper Encoder Thingy

cat /usr/share/doc/yaret/README
cat /usr/share/yaret/dot-yaretrc
nano ~/.yaretrc
yaret --option_only


# A Better CD Encoder
http://www.andrews-corner.org/abcde.html


# Extracting audio data from a CDDA - cdparanoia
http://howto-pages.org/cdwriting/10.php

cdparanoia -Q -d /dev/sr1




# Creates file data.bin and table of contents file toc-file.toc. This is NOT a fast process
cdrdao read-cd --device 1,0,0 toc-file
cdrdao read-cd --device 0,4,0 --buffers 64 --driver generic-mmc-raw --read-raw toc-file.toc
cdrdao read-cd --source-device 0,0,0 --driver generic-mmc --paranoia-mode 3 audiocd.toc
cdrdao read-cd --source-device /dev/scd0 --driver generic-mmc --paranoia-mode 3 audiocd.toc


cdrdao show-toc --source-device /dev/scd0
cdrdao show-toc [options] toc-file
cdrdao toc-info --source-device /dev/scd0
cdrdao toc-info [options] toc-file

cdrdao show-data
cdrdao discid --source-device /dev/scd0
cdrdao disk-info --source-device /dev/scd0



cdrdao
########################################################################
donald@SVP1121:~$ cdrdao
Cdrdao version 1.2.3 - (C) Andreas Mueller <andreas@daneb.de>

Usage: cdrdao <command> [options] [toc-file]
command:
  show-toc   - prints out toc and exits
  toc-info   - prints out short toc-file summary
  toc-size   - prints total number of blocks for toc
  read-toc   - create toc file from audio CD
  read-cd    - create toc and rip audio data from CD
  read-cddb  - contact CDDB server and add data as CD-TEXT to toc-file
  show-data  - prints out audio data and exits
  read-test  - reads all audio files and exits
  disk-info  - shows information about inserted medium
  discid     - prints out CDDB information
  msinfo     - shows multi session info, output is suited for scripts
  drive-info - shows drive information
  unlock     - unlock drive after failed writing
  blank      - blank a CD-RW
  scanbus    - scan for devices
  simulate   - shortcut for 'write --simulate'
  write      - writes CD
  copy       - copies CD


 Try 'cdrdao <command> -h' to get a list of available options





cdrdao disk-info --source-device /dev/scd0
########################################################################
donald@LatitudeE4200:/tmp$ cdrdao disk-info --source-device /dev/scd0
Cdrdao version 1.2.3 - (C) Andreas Mueller <andreas@daneb.de>
/dev/sr1: TSSTcorp CDDVDW SE-218CB    Rev: TS00
Using driver: Generic SCSI-3/MMC - Version 2.0 (options 0x0000)

That data below may not reflect the real status of the inserted medium
if a simulation run was performed before. Reload the medium in this case.

CD-RW                : no
Total Capacity       : n/a
CD-R medium          : n/a
Recording Speed      : n/a
CD-R empty           : no
Toc Type             : CD-DA or CD-ROM
Sessions             : 1
Last Track           : 19
Appendable           : no

GCDMASTER - Easy and Powerful CD Mastering - NOT SUPPORTED IN Debian 8
http://cdrdao.sourceforge.net/gcdmaster/index.html
http://cdrdao.sourceforge.net/gcdmaster/download.html


Or use Brasero GUI
Disc Copy (Create 1:1 copy of a CD/DVD) ->
Select disc to copy: Audio disc (CD-ROM):  58min
Select a disc to write to: Image File -> Properties (Disc image type: Cdrdao image / Cue image / Readcd/Readom image )




The International Standard Recording Code (ISRC) is an international standard code for uniquely identifying sound recordings and music video recordings.
ISRC codes are always 12 characters long, in the form "CC-XXX-YY-NNNNN".


    "CC" is the appropriate two-character country code for the ISRC issuer. The code is assigned according to the ISO 3166-1-Alpha-2 standard. (High demand for ISRCs within the United States has caused the supply of available registrant codes to become exhausted; after December 6, 2010, new registrants in the U.S. use country code "QM".[2] The codes "CP", and "DG" are reserved for further overflow, and "ZZ" is reserved for codes assigned by the International ISRC Agency.[3])
    "XXX" is a three character alphanumeric registrant code of the ISRC issuer. (This number by itself does NOT uniquely identify the ISRC issuer as the same 3-digit number may be used in various countries for different issuers. To uniquely identify an issuer, the country code and registrant code should be used together.)
    "YY" represent the last two digits of the reference year – the year that the ISRC was assigned to the recording. This is not necessarily the date the recording was made.
    "NNNNN" is a 5-digit number that identifies the particular sound or video recording, unique within the scope of the reference year.

# Needed for cdemu-code/cdemu-daemon installation build dependencies libmirage10-dev (>= 3.0.0)
http://pkgs.org/debian-sid/multimedia-main-amd64/libmirage10-dev_3.0.4-dmo2_amd64.deb.html


#1 Add Deb-Multimedia SID to your sources.list file
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list
########################################################################
# For sid (unstable) amd64, arm64, armel, armhf, i386, kfreebsd-amd64, kfreebsd-i386, mips, mipsel, powerpc and sparc packages.
deb http://www.deb-multimedia.org sid main non-free
deb-src http://www.deb-multimedia.org sid main
########################################################################



#2
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install deb-multimedia-keyring
sudo apt-get install libmirage10-dev




#3 Remove Deb-Multimedia SID to your sources.list file
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list
########################################################################
# For sid (unstable) amd64, arm64, armel, armhf, i386, kfreebsd-amd64, kfreebsd-i386, mips, mipsel, powerpc and sparc packages.
#deb http://www.deb-multimedia.org sid main non-free
#deb-src http://www.deb-multimedia.org sid main
########################################################################


#4
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo apt-get update

wget https://sourceforge.net/projects/deadbeef/files/debian/deadbeef-static_0.7.2-2_amd64.deb
sudo dpkg -i deadbeef-static_0.7.2-2_amd64.deb
sudo apt-get -f install

#    Wine Is Not an Emulator 32-bit / 64-bit
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://www.winehq.org/
http://sourceforge.net/projects/wine/files/Source/
http://dev.carbon-project.org/debian/wine-unstable/


https://packages.debian.org/jessie-backports/wine32


Stable:Wine 1.8.1 (shortlog)
Development:Wine 1.9.5 (shortlog)


Jessie:
########################################################################
sudo apt-cache policy wine
sudo apt-cache rdepends wine
sudo apt-cache search wine
sudo apt-show-versions wine
########################################################################
sudo apt-cache policy wine32
sudo apt-cache rdepends wine32
sudo apt-cache search wine32
sudo apt-show-versions wine32




donald@Inspiron2200:~$ sudo apt-cache policy wine
wine:
  Installed: (none)
  Candidate: 1.6.2-20
  Version table:
     1.8.1-2 0
        200 http://ftp.debian.org/debian/ unstable/main i386 Packages
        500 http://ftp.debian.org/debian/ testing/main i386 Packages
     1.8-2~bpo8+1 0
        100 http://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian/ jessie-backports/main i386 Packages
     1.6.2-20 0
        700 http://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian/ jessie/main i386 Packages


# Install
sudo dpkg --add-architecture i386
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install ttf-mscorefonts-installer

# 32-bit
sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install  wine32 -y


# 64-bit on 64-bit system
sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install  wine32 -y
sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install  wine64 wine64-preloader -y


# TEST on 64-bit version next time!
sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install wine -y



sudo apt-get install cu

# Check the installed version
wine32 --version
wine --version

# Configure WINE for root
sudo winecfg

# Configure WINE for user
winecfg




# Uninstall Wine
sudo apt-get purge wine
rm -rf ~/.wine

# Install Total Commander 32/64 version
wine tcmd852ax32_64.exe
wine tcmd852ax64.exe

# To run a program
/windows/.../program.exe.

# To Uninstall
wine uninstaller




## Kinetic - BaseStation - DOES NOT WORK
########################################################################
# http://blog.aprs.fi/2008/01/running-sbs-1-basestation-on-linux.html
# http://ipv6.aprs.fi
# http://linuxcommand.org/man_pages/nc1.html


cd ~/Install
wget http://www.kinetic.co.uk/DownloadFiles/Basestation_183/BaseStation-1-2-4-184-CDROM.zip
mkdir BaseStation-1-2-4-184-CDROM
unzip BaseStation-1-2-4-184-CDROM.zip -d ~/Install/BaseStation-1-2-4-184-CDROM
cd ~/Install/BaseStation-1-2-4-184-CDROM

# Windows 7 missing "ftd2xx.dll missing"
copy c:\users\YOURUSERNAME\Temp\i386\
ftserui2.dll
ftser2k.sys
ftlang.dll
ftdibus.sys
ftd2xx.lib
ftd2xx.dll
ftcserco.dll
ftbusui.dll
to you BaseStation Installation folder c:\Program Files (x86)\Kinetic\BaseStation\

wine-safe setup.exe
wine setup.exe

lsusb -t
/:  Bus 03.Port 1: Dev 1, Class=root_hub, Driver=ehci-pci/2p, 480M
    |__ Port 1: Dev 2, If 0, Class=Hub, Driver=hub/8p, 480M
/:  Bus 02.Port 1: Dev 1, Class=root_hub, Driver=xhci_hcd/4p, 5000M
/:  Bus 01.Port 1: Dev 1, Class=root_hub, Driver=xhci_hcd/9p, 480M

    |__ Port 1: Dev 2, If 1, Class=Vendor Specific Class, Driver=ftdi_sio, 12M
    |__ Port 3: Dev 3, If 0, Class=Human Interface Device, Driver=usbhid, 12M
    |__ Port 5: Dev 4, If 0, Class=Video, Driver=uvcvideo, 480M
    |__ Port 5: Dev 4, If 1, Class=Video, Driver=uvcvideo, 480M




ls -ila /dev/ttyU*
46507 crw-rw---- 1 root dialout 188, 0 Apr 18 06:34 /dev/ttyUSB0
46508 crw-rw---- 1 root dialout 188, 1 Apr 18 06:34 /dev/ttyUSB1


find /dev -group dialout -exec ls -ld {} \;


ln -s /dev/ttyUSB0 ~/.wine/dosdevices/com1
ln -s /dev/ttyUSB1 ~/.wine/dosdevices/com2
. .bashrc
id
id -Gn
id -Gn $USER
id -Gn | grep dialout

ls -l /dev/ttyUSB0
dmesg | grep tty

sudo usermod -a -G dialout $USER
sudo usermod -a -G dialout <username>








nano ~/.wine/drive_c/windows/win.ini
#####################
[serialports]
Com1=/dev/ttyS0
Com2=/dev/ttyS1
#####################




Now, the SBS-1 hardware can be reached behind /dev/ttyUSB0 at 921600 bits per second. We could connect to it using
the very simple Unix "call up" program cu --nostop -s 921600 -l /dev/ttyUSB0, but we cannot talk the proprietary binary
protocol used by the SBS-1 and the BaseStation software. Yet.



So, we run cu under another very simple and extremely useful Unix tool, nc, which is the swiss army knife of TCP/IP.
We tell nc to listen on TCP port 19251 using the localhost IP address of 127.0.0.1 (so that it cannot be connected by
anyone from the Internet), and to start up the cu program when a connection arrives:


sudo apt-get install cu
cu --nostop -s 921600 -l /dev/ttyUSB0
cu --nostop -s 921600 -l /dev/ttyUSB0


# Tell it to connect over the network, the address is 127.0.0.1, and the port is 19251.
nc -l -s 127.0.0.1 -p 19251 -c "cu --nostop -s 921600 -l /dev/ttyUSB0"
nc -l -s 127.0.0.1 -p 10001 -c "cu --nostop -s 921600 -l /dev/ttyUSB0"






sudo apt-get install minicom -y

sudo apt-get install screen -y
screen dev/ttyUSB0 115200

To end the session, use Ctrl-A,Shift-K.



wine .wine/drive_c/Program\ Files/Kinetic/BaseStation/BaseStation.exe

wine .wine/drive_c/Program\ Files\ (x86\)/Kinetic/BaseStation/BaseStation.exe
ls -ila ".wine/drive_c/Program\ Files\ (x86\)/"

wine C:\\\\Program\\ Files\\ \\(x86\\)\\\\Kinetic\\\\BaseStation\\\\BaseStation.exe

WINEDEBUG=+loaddll wine start /Unix /home/claudio/.wine/drive_c/BENTEL/Omnia_xt.exe

http://www.kinetic.co.uk/DownloadFiles/Assorted/BaseStationRawDataSocket_103.pdf

## PlanePlotter - 6_4_3_1a
########################################################################
# http://www.coaa.co.uk/software_signals.htm
# http://www.coaa.co.uk/planeplotter.htm
# http://www.radarspotters.eu/forum/index.php/board,38.0.html
# http://pp-sharers.co.uk/
http://www.coaa.co.uk/rpiusers.php?authcode=cc30cefc3
http://www.coaa.co.uk/gs-mu-test.php


1# Installation
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Runtime Error (at 98:89):
OLE error 800401F3, ProgID: "WBEMSCripting.SWBEMLocator"

The problem arises because more recent installers use the unicode set and older Wine installations do not like it.
Please try this old version (6_4_3_1a).  If it works, then the new exe file should be OK.

1A# Download version of PP without unicode 6.4.3.1a
cd ~/Install
wget http://www.coaa.co.uk/planeplotter6_4_3_1a.exe
wine planeplotter6_4_3_1a.exe
C:\COAA\PlanePlotter
C:\COAA\PlanePlotter\Chart files
C:\COAA\PlanePlotter\Log files
C:\COAA\PlanePlotter\Image files


1B# Run PlanePlotter
env WINEPREFIX="/home/donald/.wine" wine C:\\COAA\\PlanePlotter\\PlanePlotter.exe
wine C:\\COAA\\PlanePlotter\\PlanePlotter.exe


1C# Upgrade to latest version  (version 6.4.4.9)
cd ~/Install
wget http://www.coaa.co.uk/planeplotter6_4_4_9.zip
unzip planeplotter6_4_4_9.zip
mv PlanePlotter.exe ~/.wine/drive_c/COAA/PlanePlotter/
ls -lha ~/.wine/drive_c/COAA/PlanePlotter/
wine C:\\COAA\\PlanePlotter\\PlanePlotter.exe




1D# Set HOME Location:
Options - Home location - Home location setup
Studland Bay: N50 39.2564 W001 57.1746

Great app to get GPS coordinates:
market://details?id=com.ublox.ucenter
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.ublox.ucenter


Latitude:
N if you have positive number
S if you have a negative number ..
Longitude:
W if you have positive number .. or
E if you have negative number "-" -49.7123 ...

# RTL dongle

Raw data from Mlats "TICK"
OK




# Airspy
"TICK" Mode-S/ADS-B --------> Airspy receiver TCP
Allow Auto Mlats - "TICK"
Raw data from Mlats - "TICK"



For Mode-S/ADS-B :
    Kinetic SBS1 series and SBS3 Mode-S receivers. http://www.kinetic.co.uk
    AirNav Systems RadarBox(tm) receiver system. http://www.airnavsystems.com/RadarBox/
    PlaneGadget Radar (No longer in production).
    Aurora SSRx receiver. http://www.auroraeurotech.com/
    Mode-S Beast / Radarscape. http://www.modesbeast.com/
    miniADSB and microADSB. http://miniadsb.web99.de/
    RxControl Mode-S receiver system (kit built). http://rxcontrol.free.fr/PicADSB/index.html
    GNS-5890 ADS-B receiver stick. http://www.gns-gmbh.com/shop/xtc/product_info.php?language=en&info=p187_GNS-5890-ADS-B-Receiver-USB-Stick.html
    RTL2832 DVB-T dongle with RTL1090 utility (by jetvision.de).

# acars / Sat info - Sat ACARS / ACRAS from JAERO
- seeing the transition from MODE-S to ACARS and back to Mode S as flights enter and leave Oceanic control.
- For anyone still thinking about putting up a dish , Alphasat/Inmarsat I-4A F4 , at 25 east [ very near to the Astra .. Sky TV... group ] is a
particularly busy location yielding good results from the Atlantic to the Arabian Sea and is pretty stable.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Configure MiniDLNA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://packages.debian.org/jessie/minidlna
https://packages.debian.org/jessie-backports/minidlna
http://sourceforge.net/projects/minidlna/

- DLNA (Digital Living Network Alliance)
A device-to-device sharing method for sharing media content among home appliances and/or
mobile devices over commonly used standard networks (HTTP, UPnP, Wi-Fi, etc)

sudo apt-cache policy minidlna
sudo apt-cache rdepends minidlna
sudo apt-cache search minidlna
sudo apt-show-versions minidlna
sudo aptitude show minidlna


# Install latest version from Jessie-Backports
sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install minidlna -y


# Reinstall
sudo apt --reinstall install minidlna


# Remove miniDLNA
sudo apt-get remove --purge minidlna


# Original config file backup
sudo cp /etc/minidlna.conf /etc/minidlna.conf.OLD


# Edit the config file
sudo nano /etc/minidlna.conf
########################################################################
media_dir=A,/home/jmaggard/Music
media_dir=V,/home/jmaggard/Videos
media_dir=P,/home/jmaggard/Pictures
media_dir=PV,/home/jmaggard/digital_camera

#   + "A" for audio  (eg. media_dir=A,/home/jmaggard/Music)
#   + "V" for video  (eg. media_dir=V,/home/jmaggard/Videos)
#   + "P" for images (eg. media_dir=P,/home/jmaggard/Pictures)
#   + "PV" for pictures and video (eg. media_dir=PV,/home/jmaggard/digital_camera)
########################################################################


# Check version / Rebuild database on Jessie
sudo minidlnad -V
sudo minidlnad -R


sudo systemctl status minidlna.service
sudo systemctl restart minidlna.service

sudo service minidlna restart
sudo service minidlna start
sudo service minidlna stop
sudo service minidlna status
sudo service minidlna force-reload

systemctl status minidlna.service






sudo mkdir /var/lib/minidlna/
sudo ln -sf /media/donald/EXT4.GPT.4TB /var/lib/minidlna/EXT4.GPT.4TB
sudo ls -ld /var/lib/minidlna/EXT4.GPT.4TB

chown -R minidlna:minidlna /home/donald/EXT4.GPT.4TB
sudo service minidlna stop
sudo minidlnad -R
sudo service minidlna restart
sudo service minidlna status
sudo service minidlna force-reload










http://127.0.0.1:8200/


#NOTES:
ssdp (1900/udp) and trivnet1 (8200/tcp) ports will need to be opened in firewall
OPEN_TCP="8200"
OPEN_UDP="1900"


#NOTES
locate libavcodec.so; locate libavformat.so


ls -ila /var/cache/minidlna
cat /var/log/minidlna.log
sudo tail -f /var/log/minidlna.log

killall minidlnad

# To run in debug mode:
minidlnad -d



NOTES:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
donald@PrecisionM6600:~/Install$ sudo service minidlna status
● minidlna.service
   Loaded: masked (/dev/null)
   Active: inactive (dead)

Warning: Unit file changed on disk, 'systemctl daemon-reload' recommended.




# WORKING
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://serverfault.com/questions/743052/unit-polkitd-service-is-masked

rmdir /etc/systemd/system/minidlna.service.d

#    MPD (Music player daemon)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.musicpd.org/
http://mpd.wikia.com/wiki/Music_Player_Daemon_HOWTO_Troubleshoot
http://git.musicpd.org/cgit/master/mpd.git/plain/NEWS
ver 0.19.12 (2015/12/15) - Latest
ver 0.19.13 (2016/02/23)
ver 0.19.14 (not yet released)
ver 0.20 (not yet released)

https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MPD
https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Music_Player_Daemon
http://www.raspyfi.com/ho-to-install-mpd-on-an-existing-debian-installation-on-raspberry-pi/



https://packages.debian.org/jessie-backports/mpd

sudo apt-cache policy mpd
sudo apt-cache rdepends mpd
sudo apt-cache search mpd
sudo apt-show-versions mpd
sudo aptitude show mpd


#0 Check that alsa-utils is present
sudo apt-get install alsa-utils -y

and PulseAudio Preferences ???
sudo apt-get install paprefs -y

https://packages.debian.org/jessie/paprefs

#1 Check what's available and where
sudo apt-cache policy mpd

donald@LatitudeE4200:~/Install$ sudo apt-cache policy mpd
mpd:
  Installed: (none)
  Candidate: 1:0.19.9-dmo2
  Version table:

        750 http://www.deb-multimedia.org/ sid/main amd64 Packages

        800 http://www.deb-multimedia.org/ jessie/main amd64 Packages

        200 http://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian/ unstable/main amd64 Packages
        500 http://ftp.debian.org/debian/ testing/main amd64 Packages
     0.19.12-1~bpo8+1 0
        100 http://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian/ jessie-backports/main amd64 Packages
     0.19.1-1.1 0
        800 http://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian/ jessie/main amd64 Packages




#2 Will install 19.12-1 from Jessie-Backports
sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install mpd


#3 Install Gnome Music Player Client and ncurses-based audio player
sudo apt-get install mpc gmpc ncmpc sonata -y


#4 Check that mpd is running and what port
sudo netstat -apn|grep mpd
sudo netcat localhost 6600







#A Dependencies for building from source
------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo apt-get install g++ \
  libmad0-dev libmpg123-dev libid3tag0-dev \
  libflac-dev libvorbis-dev libopus-dev \
  libadplug-dev libaudiofile-dev libsndfile1-dev libfaad-dev \
  libfluidsynth-dev libgme-dev libmikmod2-dev libmodplug-dev \
  libmpcdec-dev libwavpack-dev libwildmidi-dev \
  libsidplay2-dev libsidutils-dev libresid-builder-dev \
  libavcodec-dev libavformat-dev \
  libmp3lame-dev \
  libsamplerate0-dev libsoxr-dev \
  libbz2-dev libcdio-paranoia-dev libiso9660-dev libmms-dev \
  libzzip-dev \
  libcurl4-gnutls-dev libyajl-dev libexpat-dev \
  libasound2-dev libao-dev libjack-jackd2-dev libopenal-dev \
  libpulse-dev libroar-dev libshout3-dev \
  libmpdclient-dev \
  libnfs-dev libsmbclient-dev \
  libupnp-dev \
  libavahi-client-dev \
  libsqlite3-dev \
  libsystemd-daemon-dev libwrap0-dev \
  libcppunit-dev xmlto \
  libboost-dev \
  libicu-dev




#B
------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd git
git clone git://git.musicpd.org/master/mpd.git
cd mpd


# or
wget http://www.musicpd.org/download/mpd/0.19/mpd-0.19.12.tar.xz
tar xf mpd-0.19.12.tar.xz
cd mpd-0.19.12
./configure
make
make install





#3C
------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo nano /etc/mpd.conf
########################################################################
music_directory        "/media/donald/TOSHIBA_EXT"
bind_to_address         "any"


audio_output {
     device          "hw:1,0"    # optional usb output. Keep 0,0 if using the Pi audio
 }
 
mixer_type                      "software"

########################################################################



If you have a usb dac, let’s tell mpd to use this instead of the shitty analog out:

audio_output {
type “alsa”
name “USB Dac”
device “hw:1,0″ # optional
format “44100:16:2″ # optional
mixer_device “default” # optional
# mixer_control “PCM” # optional
# mixer_index “0″ # optional



If you wish to enable audio buffering (and so ram reading). Uncomment these strings:
#audio_buffer_size “2048″
#buffer_before_play “10%”

If you want to send the audio stream directly to the usb dac, bypassing any software\hardware mixer. Change the string:
mixer_device “default”
in
mixer_device “none”
########################################################################
music_directory        "smb://MyServerNameOrAddress/path/to/Music"
 bind_to_address         "any"
 audio_output {
     device          "hw:1,0"    # optional usb output. Keep 0,0 if using the Pi audio
 }
 mixer_type                      "software"
 


 
sudo cat /etc/mpd.conf
########################################################################
########################################################################
# An example configuration file for MPD.
# Read the user manual for documentation: http://www.musicpd.org/doc/user/
# or /usr/share/doc/mpd/user-manual.html


# Files and directories #######################################################
#
# This setting controls the top directory which MPD will search to discover the
# available audio files and add them to the daemon's online database. This
# setting defaults to the XDG directory, otherwise the music directory will be
# be disabled and audio files will only be accepted over ipc socket (using
# file:// protocol) or streaming files over an accepted protocol.
#
#music_directory        "/media/donald/TOSHIBA_EXT"
music_directory             "/home/donald/Music"
#
# This setting sets the MPD internal playlist directory. The purpose of this
# directory is storage for playlists created by MPD. The server will use
# playlist files not created by the server but only if they are in the MPD
# format. This setting defaults to playlist saving being disabled.
#
#playlist_directory        "/media/donald/TOSHIBA_EXT/playlists"
playlist_directory              "/home/donald/Music/playlists"
#
# This setting sets the location of the MPD database. This file is used to
# load the database at server start up and store the database while the
# server is not up. This setting defaults to disabled which will allow
# MPD to accept files over ipc socket (using file:// protocol) or streaming
# files over an accepted protocol.
#
db_file            "/var/lib/mpd/tag_cache"
#
# These settings are the locations for the daemon log files for the daemon.
# These logs are great for troubleshooting, depending on your log_level
# settings.
#
# The special value "syslog" makes MPD use the local syslog daemon. This
# setting defaults to logging to syslog, otherwise logging is disabled.
#
log_file            "/var/log/mpd/mpd.log"
#
# This setting sets the location of the file which stores the process ID
# for use of mpd --kill and some init scripts. This setting is disabled by
# default and the pid file will not be stored.
#
pid_file            "/run/mpd/pid"
#
# This setting sets the location of the file which contains information about
# most variables to get MPD back into the same general shape it was in before
# it was brought down. This setting is disabled by default and the server
# state will be reset on server start up.
#
#state_file            "/var/lib/mpd/state"
#
# The location of the sticker database.  This is a database which
# manages dynamic information attached to songs.
#
#sticker_file                   "/var/lib/mpd/sticker.sql"
#
###############################################################################


# General music daemon options ################################################
#
# This setting specifies the user that MPD will run as. MPD should never run as
# root and you may use this setting to make MPD change its user ID after
# initialization. This setting is disabled by default and MPD is run as the
# current user.
#
#user                "mpd"
#
# This setting specifies the group that MPD will run as. If not specified
# primary group of user specified with "user" setting will be used (if set).
# This is useful if MPD needs to be a member of group such as "audio" to
# have permission to use sound card.
#
#group                          "nogroup"
#
# This setting sets the address for the daemon to listen on. Careful attention
# should be paid if this is assigned to anything other then the default, any.
# This setting can deny access to control of the daemon. Choose any if you want
# to have mpd listen on every address
#
# For network
#bind_to_address        "localhost"
bind_to_address             "any"
#
# And for Unix Socket
#bind_to_address        "/run/mpd/socket"
#
# This setting is the TCP port that is desired for the daemon to get assigned
# to.
#
port                "6600"
#
# This setting controls the type of information which is logged. Available
# setting arguments are "default", "secure" or "verbose". The "verbose" setting
# argument is recommended for troubleshooting, though can quickly stretch
# available resources on limited hardware storage.
#
#log_level            "default"
log_level                       "verbose"
#
# If you have a problem with your MP3s ending abruptly it is recommended that
# you set this argument to "no" to attempt to fix the problem. If this solves
# the problem, it is highly recommended to fix the MP3 files with vbrfix
# (available as vbrfix in the debian archive), at which
# point gapless MP3 playback can be enabled.
#
#gapless_mp3_playback            "yes"
#
# Setting "restore_paused" to "yes" puts MPD into pause mode instead
# of starting playback after startup.
#
#restore_paused "no"
#
# This setting enables MPD to create playlists in a format usable by other
# music players.
#
#save_absolute_paths_in_playlists    "no"
#
# This setting defines a list of tag types that will be extracted during the
# audio file discovery process. The complete list of possible values can be
# found in the mpd.conf man page.
#metadata_to_use    "artist,album,title,track,name,genre,date,composer,performer,disc"
#
# This setting enables automatic update of MPD's database when files in
# music_directory are changed.
#
auto_update    "yes"
#
# Limit the depth of the directories being watched, 0 means only watch
# the music directory itself.  There is no limit by default.
#
#auto_update_depth "3"
#
###############################################################################


# Symbolic link behavior ######################################################
#
# If this setting is set to "yes", MPD will discover audio files by following
# symbolic links outside of the configured music_directory.
#
#follow_outside_symlinks    "yes"
#
# If this setting is set to "yes", MPD will discover audio files by following
# symbolic links inside of the configured music_directory.
#
#follow_inside_symlinks        "yes"
#
###############################################################################


# Zeroconf / Avahi Service Discovery ##########################################
#
# If this setting is set to "yes", service information will be published with
# Zeroconf / Avahi.
#
#zeroconf_enabled        "yes"
#
# The argument to this setting will be the Zeroconf / Avahi unique name for
# this MPD server on the network.
#
#zeroconf_name            "Music Player"
#
###############################################################################


# Permissions #################################################################
#
# If this setting is set, MPD will require password authorization. The password
# can setting can be specified multiple times for different password profiles.
#
#password                        "password@read,add,control,admin"
#
# This setting specifies the permissions a user has who has not yet logged in.
#
#default_permissions             "read,add,control,admin"
#
###############################################################################


# Database #######################################################################
#

#database {
#       plugin "proxy"
#       host "other.mpd.host"
#       port "6600"
#}

# Input #######################################################################
#

input {
        plugin "curl"
#       proxy "proxy.isp.com:8080"
#       proxy_user "user"
#       proxy_password "password"
}

#
###############################################################################

# Audio Output ################################################################
#
# MPD supports various audio output types, as well as playing through multiple
# audio outputs at the same time, through multiple audio_output settings
# blocks. Setting this block is optional, though the server will only attempt
# autodetection for one sound card.
#
# An example of an ALSA output:
#
audio_output {
    type        "alsa"
    name        "My ALSA Device"
#    device        "hw:0,0"    # optional
#    mixer_type      "hardware"      # optional
#    mixer_device    "default"    # optional
#    mixer_control    "PCM"        # optional
#    mixer_index    "0"        # optional
}
#
# An example of an OSS output:
#
#audio_output {
#    type        "oss"
#    name        "My OSS Device"
#    device        "/dev/dsp"    # optional
#    mixer_type      "hardware"      # optional
#    mixer_device    "/dev/mixer"    # optional
#    mixer_control    "PCM"        # optional
#}
#
# An example of a shout output (for streaming to Icecast):
#
#audio_output {
#    type        "shout"
#    encoding    "ogg"            # optional
#    name        "My Shout Stream"
#    host        "localhost"
#    port        "8000"
#    mount        "/mpd.ogg"
#    password    "hackme"
#    quality        "5.0"
#    bitrate        "128"
#    format        "44100:16:1"
#    protocol    "icecast2"        # optional
#    user        "source"        # optional
#    description    "My Stream Description"    # optional
#    url             "http://example.com"    # optional
#    genre        "jazz"            # optional
#    public        "no"            # optional
#    timeout        "2"            # optional
#    mixer_type      "software"              # optional
#}
#
# An example of a recorder output:
#
#audio_output {
#       type            "recorder"
#       name            "My recorder"
#       encoder         "vorbis"                # optional, vorbis or lame
#       path            "/var/lib/mpd/recorder/mpd.ogg"
##      quality         "5.0"                   # do not define if bitrate is defined
#       bitrate         "128"                   # do not define if quality is defined
#       format          "44100:16:1"
#}
#
# An example of a httpd output (built-in HTTP streaming server):
#
#audio_output {
#    type        "httpd"
#    name        "My HTTP Stream"
#    encoder        "vorbis"        # optional, vorbis or lame
#    port        "8000"
#    bind_to_address "0.0.0.0"               # optional, IPv4 or IPv6
#    quality        "5.0"            # do not define if bitrate is defined
#    bitrate        "128"            # do not define if quality is defined
#    format        "44100:16:1"
#    max_clients     "0"                     # optional 0=no limit
#}
#
# An example of a pulseaudio output (streaming to a remote pulseaudio server)
# Please see README.Debian if you want mpd to play through the pulseaudio
# daemon started as part of your graphical desktop session!
#
#audio_output {
#    type        "pulse"
#    name        "My Pulse Output"
#    server        "remote_server"        # optional
#    sink        "remote_server_sink"    # optional
#}
#
# An example of a winmm output (Windows multimedia API).
#
#audio_output {
#    type        "winmm"
#    name        "My WinMM output"
#    device        "Digital Audio (S/PDIF) (High Definition Audio Device)" # optional
#        or
#    device        "0"        # optional
#    mixer_type    "hardware"    # optional
#}
#
# An example of an openal output.
#
#audio_output {
#    type        "openal"
#    name        "My OpenAL output"
#    device        "Digital Audio (S/PDIF) (High Definition Audio Device)" # optional
#}
#
## Example "pipe" output:
#
#audio_output {
#    type        "pipe"
#    name        "my pipe"
#    command        "aplay -f cd 2>/dev/null"
## Or if you're want to use AudioCompress
#    command        "AudioCompress -m | aplay -f cd 2>/dev/null"
## Or to send raw PCM stream through PCM:
#    command        "nc example.org 8765"
#    format        "44100:16:2"
#}
#
## An example of a null output (for no audio output):
#
#audio_output {
#    type        "null"
#    name        "My Null Output"
#    mixer_type      "none"                  # optional
#}
#
# If MPD has been compiled with libsamplerate support, this setting specifies
# the sample rate converter to use.  Possible values can be found in the
# mpd.conf man page or the libsamplerate documentation. By default, this is
# setting is disabled.
#
#samplerate_converter        "Fastest Sinc Interpolator"
#
###############################################################################


# Normalization automatic volume adjustments ##################################
#
# This setting specifies the type of ReplayGain to use. This setting can have
# the argument "off", "album", "track" or "auto". "auto" is a special mode that
# chooses between "track" and "album" depending on the current state of
# random playback. If random playback is enabled then "track" mode is used.
# See <http://www.replaygain.org> for more details about ReplayGain.
# This setting is off by default.
#
#replaygain            "album"
#
# This setting sets the pre-amp used for files that have ReplayGain tags. By
# default this setting is disabled.
#
#replaygain_preamp        "0"
#
# This setting sets the pre-amp used for files that do NOT have ReplayGain tags.
# By default this setting is disabled.
#
#replaygain_missing_preamp    "0"
#
# This setting enables or disables ReplayGain limiting.
# MPD calculates actual amplification based on the ReplayGain tags
# and replaygain_preamp / replaygain_missing_preamp setting.
# If replaygain_limit is enabled MPD will never amplify audio signal
# above its original level. If replaygain_limit is disabled such amplification
# might occur. By default this setting is enabled.
#
#replaygain_limit        "yes"
#
# This setting enables on-the-fly normalization volume adjustment. This will
# result in the volume of all playing audio to be adjusted so the output has
# equal "loudness". This setting is disabled by default.
#
#volume_normalization        "no"
#
###############################################################################


# MPD Internal Buffering ######################################################
#
# This setting adjusts the size of internal decoded audio buffering. Changing
# this may have undesired effects. Don't change this if you don't know what you
# are doing.
#
#audio_buffer_size        "4096"
#
# This setting controls the percentage of the buffer which is filled before
# beginning to play. Increasing this reduces the chance of audio file skipping,
# at the cost of increased time prior to audio playback.
#
#buffer_before_play        "10%"
#
###############################################################################


# Resource Limitations ########################################################
#
# These settings are various limitations to prevent MPD from using too many
# resources. Generally, these settings should be minimized to prevent security
# risks, depending on the operating resources.
#
#connection_timeout        "60"
#max_connections        "10"
#max_playlist_length        "16384"
#max_command_list_size        "2048"
#max_output_buffer_size        "8192"
#
###############################################################################

# Character Encoding ##########################################################
#
# If file or directory names do not display correctly for your locale then you
# may need to modify this setting.
#
filesystem_charset        "UTF-8"
#
# This setting controls the encoding that ID3v1 tags should be converted from.
#
id3v1_encoding            "UTF-8"
#
###############################################################################


# SIDPlay decoder #############################################################
#
# songlength_database:
#  Location of your songlengths file, as distributed with the HVSC.
#  The sidplay plugin checks this for matching MD5 fingerprints.
#  See http://www.c64.org/HVSC/DOCUMENTS/Songlengths.faq
#
# default_songlength:
#  This is the default playing time in seconds for songs not in the
#  songlength database, or in case you're not using a database.
#  A value of 0 means play indefinitely.
#
# filter:
#  Turns the SID filter emulation on or off.
#
#decoder {
#       plugin                  "sidplay"
#       songlength_database     "/media/C64Music/DOCUMENTS/Songlengths.txt"
#       default_songlength      "120"
#       filter "true"
#}
#
###############################################################################






 

#C - systemd socket activation
------------------------------------------------------------------------
--with-systemdsystemunitdir=/lib/systemd.

sudo systemctl enable mpd.socket
sudo systemctl start mpd.socket



sudo systemctl stop mpd
sudo systemctl start mpd
sudo systemctl restart mpd


sudo cat /var/log/mpd/mpd.log


sudo service mpd status
sudo service mpd force-reload
sudo service mpd status
sudo service mpd restart
sudo service mpd status
{start|stop|restart|force-reload}






#E - TROUBLESHOOTING
------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo mpd -V

aplay -l
aplay -L
alsamixer

ps aux | grep mpd
ps -e | grep mpd$
killall mpd

sudo lsof -i :6600
sudo netstat -a |grep 6600
sudo netstat -tnlp | grep 6600

sudo /etc/init.d/mpd restart
sudo /etc/init.d/mpd stop
sudo service mpd stop


/usr/bin/mpd --stdout --no-daemon --verbose

sudo tail -f /var/log/mpd/mpd.log

sudo cat /var/log/messages.log
sudo cat /var/log/daemons.log
sudo cat /var/log/errors.log


systemctl status pulseaudio.service


cat /proc/asound/Audio/pcm0p/sub0/hw_params
cat /proc/asound/card0/pcm0p/sub0/hw_params

donald@M6600:~/Music$ cat /proc/asound/card0/pcm0p/sub0/hw_params
access: MMAP_INTERLEAVED
format: S32_LE
subformat: STD
channels: 2
rate: 48000 (48000/1)
period_size: 1024
buffer_size: 8192

donald@SVP112A1CM:~$ cat /proc/asound/card1/pcm0p/sub0/hw_params
access: MMAP_INTERLEAVED
format: S16_LE
subformat: STD
channels: 2
rate: 48000 (48000/1)
period_size: 8192
buffer_size: 16384





cat /proc/asound/card0/pcm0p/sub0/hw_params

cat /proc/asound/card1/pcm0p/sub0/hw_params







NOTES:
# DSD – Jewels concealed behind the scarlet book
http://www.ap-linux.com/articles/dsd-jewels-concealed-behind-the-scarlet-book/

bit misleading as the current kernel doesn’t support native DSD, only DoP. DoP works fine and delivers DSD ‘untouched’
but is limited to DSD128 so, for example, I am unable to play my DSD256 files on Audiophile Linux.


http://www.raspyfi.com/ho-to-install-mpd-on-an-existing-debian-installation-on-raspberry-pi/

http://moodeaudio.org/



donald@SVP112A1CM:~$ sudo cat /proc/asound/card2/stream0
Sony PHA-3 at usb-0000:00:14.0-1, high speed : USB Audio

Playback:
  Status: Stop
  Interface 1
    Altset 1
    Format: S32_LE
    Channels: 2
    Endpoint: 1 OUT (ASYNC)
    Rates: 44100, 48000, 88200, 96000, 176400, 192000, 352800, 384000
    Data packet interval: 125 us
  Interface 1
    Altset 2
    Format: S16_LE
    Channels: 2
    Endpoint: 1 OUT (ASYNC)
    Rates: 44100, 48000, 88200, 96000, 176400, 192000, 352800, 384000
    Data packet interval: 125 us
  Interface 1
    Altset 3
    Format: SPECIAL
    Channels: 2
    Endpoint: 1 OUT (ASYNC)
    Rates: 44100, 48000, 88200, 96000, 176400, 192000, 352800, 384000
    Data packet interval: 125 us


donald@SVP112A1CM:~$ sudo cat /proc/asound/card2/stream0
Sony PHA-3 at usb-0000:00:14.0-1, high speed : USB Audio

Playback:
  Status: Running
    Interface = 1
    Altset = 1
    Packet Size = 392
    Momentary freq = 352805 Hz (0x2c.19c0)
    Feedback Format = 16.16
  Interface 1
    Altset 1
    Format: S32_LE
    Channels: 2
    Endpoint: 1 OUT (ASYNC)
    Rates: 44100, 48000, 88200, 96000, 176400, 192000, 352800, 384000
    Data packet interval: 125 us
  Interface 1
    Altset 2
    Format: S16_LE
    Channels: 2
    Endpoint: 1 OUT (ASYNC)
    Rates: 44100, 48000, 88200, 96000, 176400, 192000, 352800, 384000
    Data packet interval: 125 us
  Interface 1
    Altset 3
    Format: SPECIAL
    Channels: 2
    Endpoint: 1 OUT (ASYNC)
    Rates: 44100, 48000, 88200, 96000, 176400, 192000, 352800, 384000
    Data packet interval: 125 us

Codec: Intel Haswell HDMI
Address: 0
AFG Function Id: 0x1 (unsol 0)
Vendor Id: 0x80862807
Subsystem Id: 0x80860101
Revision Id: 0x100000
No Modem Function Group found

    rates [0x0]:
    bits [0x0]:
    formats [0x0]:
Default Amp-In caps: N/A

  Power states:  D0 D3 CLKSTOP EPSS
  Power: setting=D0, actual=D0, Clock-stop-OK

  Control: name="HDMI/DP,pcm=3 Jack", index=0, device=0
  Control: name="IEC958 Playback Con Mask", index=0, device=0
  Control: name="IEC958 Playback Pro Mask", index=0, device=0

  Control: name="ELD", index=0, device=3
  Amp-Out caps: ofs=0x00, nsteps=0x00, stepsize=0x00, mute=1
  Amp-Out vals:  [0x00 0x00]
  Pincap 0x0b000094: OUT Detect HBR HDMI DP
  Pin Default 0x18560010: [Jack] Digital Out at Int HDMI
    Conn = Digital, Color = Unknown
    DefAssociation = 0x1, Sequence = 0x0
  Pin-ctls: 0x00:
  Unsolicited: tag=01, enabled=1
  Power states:  D0 D3 EPSS
  Power: setting=D0, actual=D0
  Devices: 0
  Connection: 0
  In-driver Connection: 3
     0x02 0x03 0x04
Node 0x06 [Pin Complex] wcaps 0x40778d: 8-Channels Digital Amp-Out CP
  Control: name="HDMI/DP,pcm=7 Jack", index=0, device=0
  Control: name="IEC958 Playback Con Mask", index=1, device=0
  Control: name="IEC958 Playback Pro Mask", index=1, device=0
  Control: name="IEC958 Playback Default", index=1, device=0
  Control: name="IEC958 Playback Switch", index=1, device=0
  Control: name="ELD", index=0, device=7
  Amp-Out caps: ofs=0x00, nsteps=0x00, stepsize=0x00, mute=1
  Amp-Out vals:  [0x00 0x00]
  Pincap 0x0b000094: OUT Detect HBR HDMI DP
  Pin Default 0x18560020: [Jack] Digital Out at Int HDMI
    Conn = Digital, Color = Unknown
    DefAssociation = 0x2, Sequence = 0x0
  Pin-ctls: 0x00:
  Unsolicited: tag=02, enabled=1
  Power states:  D0 D3 EPSS
  Power: setting=D0, actual=D0
  Devices: 0
  Connection: 0
  In-driver Connection: 3
     0x02 0x03 0x04
Node 0x07 [Pin Complex] wcaps 0x40778d: 8-Channels Digital Amp-Out CP
  Control: name="HDMI/DP,pcm=8 Jack", index=0, device=0
  Control: name="IEC958 Playback Con Mask", index=2, device=0
  Control: name="IEC958 Playback Pro Mask", index=2, device=0
  Control: name="IEC958 Playback Default", index=2, device=0
  Control: name="IEC958 Playback Switch", index=2, device=0
  Control: name="ELD", index=0, device=8
  Amp-Out caps: ofs=0x00, nsteps=0x00, stepsize=0x00, mute=1
  Amp-Out vals:  [0x00 0x00]
  Pincap 0x0b000094: OUT Detect HBR HDMI DP
  Pin Default 0x18560030: [Jack] Digital Out at Int HDMI
    Conn = Digital, Color = Unknown
    DefAssociation = 0x3, Sequence = 0x0
  Pin-ctls: 0x00:
  Unsolicited: tag=03, enabled=1
  Power states:  D0 D3 EPSS
  Power: setting=D0, actual=D0
  Devices: 0
  Connection: 0

     0x02 0x03 0x04
Node 0x08 [Vendor Defined Widget] wcaps 0xf00000: Mono









Back to Top...
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    client for MPD (Music player daemon) - MPC
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://mpd.wikia.com/wiki/Clients
mpc (0.26-1) - https://packages.debian.org/jessie/mpc command-line tool to interface MPD


sudo apt-cache policy mpc
sudo apt-get install mpc -y
mpc update

sudo apt-cache policy gmpc
sudo apt-get install gmpc -y

#    Speedtest from CLI @speedtest.net
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://github.com/sivel/speedtest-cli
# OR
https://github.com/sindresorhus/speed-test



Install speedtest-cli Using Git / Python Script
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

cd ~/git
git clone https://github.com/sivel/speedtest-cli.git
cd speedtest-cli
chmod +x speedtest_cli.py
# ./speedtest_cli.py  underscore
./speedtest_cli.py
./speedtest_cli.py -h




cd ~/git/speedtest-cli
./speedtest_cli.py --share
./speedtest_cli.py --list | grep -i London
./speedtest_cli.py --server 2789 --share




# Install speedtest-cli Using pythin-pip
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo apt-get install python-pip
sudo pip install speedtest-cli

# To upgrade speedtest-cli, at later stage:
sudo pip install speedtest-cli --upgrade

## speedtest-cli
speedtest-cli --simple
speedtest-cli --simple --share
speedtest-cli --list

#    MakeMKV one-click solution to convert video that you own into free and patents-unencumbered format that can be played everywhere.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.makemkv.com/download/history.html
http://www.makemkv.com/forum2/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=224


http://pkgs.org/search/?query=libfdk-aac&type=smart
sudo apt-cache policy libfdk-aac-dev libfdk-aac1
sudo apt-cache rdepends libfdk-aac-dev libfdk-aac1
sudo apt-cache search libfdk-aac-dev libfdk-aac1
sudo apt-show-versions libfdk-aac-dev libfdk-aac1



#    MakeMKV v1.10.2 (11.9.2016 ) / FFmpeg 3.1.4 "Laplace" 2016-10-01

cd ~/Install
sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install libssl-dev
sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install libgl1-mesa-dev
sudo apt-get install build-essential pkg-config libc6-dev libssl-dev libexpat1-dev libgl1-mesa-dev libqt4-dev



#    FFmpeg 3.1.4 "Laplace" 2016-10-01
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://ffmpeg.org/download.html
https://tracker.debian.org/pkg/ffmpeg


sudo apt-get install libfdk-aac0 libfdk-aac1 libfdk-aac-dev exiftool -y
sudo apt-get install yasm nasm build-essential automake autoconf libtool pkg-config libcurl4-openssl-dev intltool libxml2-dev libgtk2.0-dev libnotify-dev libglib2.0-dev libevent-dev checkinstall -y
sudo apt-get -f install


# 3.1.4 was released on 2016-10-01. It is the latest stable FFmpeg release from the 3.1 release branch, which was cut from master on 2016-06-26.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install
wget https://ffmpeg.org/releases/ffmpeg-3.1.4.tar.bz2
wget https://ffmpeg.org/releases/ffmpeg-3.1.4.tar.bz2.asc
gpg ffmpeg-3.1.4.tar.bz2.asc
gpg --keyserver pgpkeys.mit.edu --recv-key B4322F04D67658D8
gpg ffmpeg-3.1.4.tar.bz2.asc
gpg --edit-key ffmpeg-devel@ffmpeg.org trust
5
y
q
gpg ffmpeg-3.1.4.tar.bz2.asc
gpg --verify ffmpeg-3.1.4.tar.bz2.asc
tar -jxvf ffmpeg-3.1.4.tar.bz2
cd ffmpeg-3.1.4
./configure --prefix=/tmp/ffmpeg-3.1.4 --enable-static --disable-shared --enable-pic --disable-yasm --enable-libfdk-aac
make
sudo make install


# See the release notes
ls -ila /usr/share/doc/libavcodec*/RELEASE_NOTES

cat /usr/share/doc/libavcodec56/RELEASE_NOTES
cat /usr/share/doc/libavcodec-dev/RELEASE_NOTES

sudo make install

tar -xvzf makemkv-bin-1.10.2.tar.gz
cd makemkv-bin-1.10.2
make
q
yes
sudo make install



# The application will be installed as "/usr/bin/makemkv".
ls -ila /usr/bin/make*
ls -ila /usr/share/MakeMKV/*

sudo cp ~/Install/makemkv-oss-1.10.2/makemkvgui/share/icons/128x128/makemkv.png /usr/share/icons
sudo nano /usr/share/applications/makemkv.desktop
#################################################
Exec=/usr/bin/makemkv
Icon=/usr/share/icons/makemkv.png
#################################################




# RUN the program first or create mkdir ~/.MakeMKV/



# Manually set the license code (eg: that beta license code) in the MakeMKV config file ('cause you don't wanna mess with the system clock):
 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
nano ~/.MakeMKV/settings.conf
########################################################################
app_Key = "T-Rj9dmR37zXFQlCz2ljQzy8tKHPasVYXIyREZwfDSi8uwRQjo1xw7Kzdr2iDGL@4QoW"
########################################################################
Note: The "T-Rj9dmR37zXFQlCz2ljQzy8tKHPasVYXIyREZwfDSi8uwRQjo1xw7Kzdr2iDGL@4QoW" is valid until end of November 2016. Please check back for updated key on this page.
Note: The "T-MiqalQ5FtsaHBNMeZa1DTjKoBjewmoE1tPF9c@oh7u0F8RdbBSvWfvoT_2O4hoF1y2" is valid until end of July 2016. Please check back for updated key on page below.
http://www.makemkv.com/forum2/viewtopic.php?f=5&t=1053


MakeMKV preferences:
General:
- Log debug messages = TICK
- Expert mode = TICK


Advanced:
- Default selection rule: -sel:all,+sel:(favlang|nolang|single),-sel:(havemulti|havecore),-sel:mvcvideo,=100:all,-10:favlang
- dstdecoderdll.dll location:
cd  ~/.MakeMKV/
wget https:// /DTS-HD.Arcsoft/dtsdecoderdll.dll


#NOTES
DTS-HD -> FLAC - not supported on Samsung TV F8000
DTS-HD -> Default - works on Samsung TV F8000



# DTS-HD decoding
http://www.makemkv.com/dtshd/

July 2015 UPDATE:
Starting from version 1.9.3 MakeMKV uses an open source DTS-HD decoding library without the need for any additional files.
The information below is outdated and is preserved only for historical reasons.
DTS-HD decoding is now handled by open-source libdcadec library


# DTS-HD MA Open source decoder
http://www.makemkv.com/forum2/viewtopic.php?p=39733#p39733
DTS-HD decoding is now handled by open-source libdcadec library (dtsdecoderdll.dll is still required for DTS express only)
http://www.dts.com/professionals/sound-technologies/codecs/dts-express.aspx

# dts decoder dll question flac
http://www.makemkv.com/forum2/viewtopic.php?p=48560#p48560
The unique limitation, at this moment, is than not support 'DTS-Express' tracks (low bitrate for comentary, for instance).
But I'm sure than you don't need convert these tracks to flac.

DTS  Decoder
https://github.com/foo86/dcadec
cd ~/git
git clone https://github.com/foo86/dcadec.git
cd dcadec
./dcadec [-26bcfhlmnPqSx] <input.dts> [output.wav]

DTS  Encoder
http://patrakov.blogspot.co.uk/2011/09/i-wrote-dts-encoder.html
http://aepatrakov.narod.ru/index/0-2



The dtsdecoderdll.dll is part of Arcsoft TMT player software.
Starting from version 1.7.5 MakeMKV can decode DTS-HD audio streams and save them in any supported format (LPCM, FLAC, etc).

exiftool dtsdecoderdll.dll
#################################################
ExifTool Version Number         : 9.74
File Name                       : dtsdecoderdll.dll
Directory                       : .
File Size                       : 908 kB
File Modification Date/Time     : 2014:09:28 12:29:18+01:00
File Access Date/Time           : 2016:04:07 22:59:01+01:00
File Inode Change Date/Time     : 2016:04:07 22:59:01+01:00
File Permissions                : rw-------
File Type                       : Win32 DLL
MIME Type                       : application/octet-stream
Machine Type                    : Intel 386 or later, and compatibles
Time Stamp                      : 2009:08:12 08:55:44+01:00

Linker Version                  : 8.0
Code Size                       : 618496
Initialized Data Size           : 307200
Uninitialized Data Size         : 0

Image Version                   : 0.0

Subsystem                       : Windows GUI

Product Version Number          : 1.1.0.7

File Subtype                    : 0

# Steaming
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 http://www.makemkv.com/faq/item/5
localhost:51000/stream/title0.ts
http://127.0.0.1:51000/stream/title0.vob?2fc1c6143a4411ae

http://127.0.0.1:51000/s.html
http://127.0.0.1:51000/web/


# Remove the actual program
------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo rm /usr/bin/makemkv
sudo rm /usr/bin/makemkvcon


# To uninstall run:
------------------------------------------------------------------------
dpkg -r makemkv_v1.6.10_oss
dpkg -r makemkv_v1.6.10_bin


# Remove the config files
------------------------------------------------------------------------
rm -r ~/.MakeMKV





# command-line:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.makemkv.com/developers/
http://www.makemkv.com/developers/usage.txt


# Streaming from command line:
makemkvcon stream
makemkvcon stream --upnp=1 --cache=128 --bindip=192.168.1.102 --bindport=51000 --messages=-none


# List all available drives
makemkvcon -r --cache=1 info disc:9999

# Scan BD infos
makemkvcon info dev:/dev/sr0




# Make backup
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.makemkv.com/faq/item/4

makemkvcon backup --decrypt





#About BD+ and SVQ files:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.makemkv.com/svq/

SVQ file is a small (typically less than 64 bytes) file that contains keys necessary to execute BD+ program. SVQ files come in two flavors - generic SVQs and disc-specific SVQs.
Starting from version 1.5.8 MakeMKV downloads all required SVQ files automatically - all discs that require disc-specific SVQ should work without any additional steps.
cd  ~/.MakeMKV/
wget http://www.makemkv.com/svq/dsall.svq

# Alternative - Install ffmpeg from Git Repository - FFmpeg 3.0.1 "Einstein"
------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://ffmpeg.org/git-howto.html

cd ~/git
git clone git://source.ffmpeg.org/ffmpeg.git
git clone git://source.ffmpeg.org/ffmpeg.git ffmpeg
cd ffmpeg
cat RELEASE
cat README.md INSTALL.md
./configure --prefix=/tmp/ffmpeg --enable-static --disable-shared --enable-pic --disable-yasm --enable-libfdk-aac
make
sudo make install

sudo checkinstall




MakeMKV v1.9.8 (20.12.2015 ) / ffmpeg-2.8.4 / FFmpeg 2.8.6 "Feynman"
------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install
sudo apt-get install build-essential pkg-config libc6-dev libssl-dev libexpat1-dev libavcodec-dev libgl1-mesa-dev libqt4-dev


# Compile a recent ffmpeg (at least 2.0) if you need a FLAC encoder that handles 24-bit audio need to install libfdk-aac-dev for Wheezy or libfdk-aac for Jessie
------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install
wget http://ffmpeg.org/releases/ffmpeg-2.8.4.tar.bz2
tar -jxvf ffmpeg-2.8.4.tar.bz2
cd ffmpeg-2.8.4
./configure --prefix=/tmp/ffmpeg --enable-static --disable-shared --enable-pic --disable-yasm --enable-libfdk-aac
make install
rm -rf /tmp/ffmpeg


cd ..
wget http://www.makemkv.com/download/makemkv-oss-1.9.8.tar.gz
tar -xvzf makemkv-oss-1.9.8.tar.gz
cd makemkv-oss-1.9.8
CFLAGS="-D __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS" PKG_CONFIG_PATH=/tmp/ffmpeg/lib/pkgconfig ./configure
make
sudo make install

# Desktop Icon
sudo cp ~/Install/makemkv-oss-1.9.8/makemkvgui/share/icons/128x128/makemkv.png /usr/share/icons
sudo nano /usr/share/applications/makemkv.desktop
#################################################
Exec=/usr/bin/makemkv
Icon=/usr/share/icons/makemkv.png
#################################################


cd ..
wget http://www.makemkv.com/download/makemkv-bin-1.9.8.tar.gz
tar -xvzf makemkv-bin-1.9.8.tar.gz
cd makemkv-bin-1.9.8
make
YES to T&C
sudo make install

The application will be installed as "/usr/bin/makemkv".


locations/makemkv.desktop


# Manually set the license code (eg: that beta license code) in the MakeMKV config file ('cause you don't wanna mess with the system clock):
nano ~/.MakeMKV/settings.conf
########################################################################
app_Key = " T-s3SN8ux5qQlNBylE3l1GXnsJaLJoU7VFlM7k0SUSKA7qABr4t9DUwqHUMmV0DUT7QY"
########################################################################
Note: The "T-s3SN8ux5qQlNBylE3l1GXnsJaLJoU7VFlM7k0SUSKA7qABr4t9DUwqHUMmV0DUT7QY"
string is the current (thru end of May 2016) beta license code found at:https://tracker.debian.org/pkg/ffmpeg
http://www.makemkv.com/forum2/viewtopic.php?f=5&t=1053



# makemkv-oss ./configure OPTIONS
------------------------------------------------------------------------
CFLAGS="-D __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS" ./configure
# or
> CFLAGS="-D __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS" ./configure
# or
PKG_CONFIG_PATH=/tmp/ffmpeg/lib/pkgconfig ./configure
# or all together
> CFLAGS="-D __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS" PKG_CONFIG_PATH=/tmp/ffmpeg/lib/pkgconfig ./configure
# or YES-WORKING
CFLAGS="-D __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS" PKG_CONFIG_PATH=/tmp/ffmpeg/lib/pkgconfig ./configure












#MakeMKV v1.9.10 (17.4.2016 ) / ffmpeg-3.0.2
#MakeMKV v1.9.9 (17.1.2016 ) / ffmpeg-3.0.1

libavcodec-dev = libavcodec57
http://pkgs.org/debian-sid/multimedia-main-amd64/libavcodec57_3.0.1-dmo1_amd64.deb.html

sudo apt-get install build-essential pkg-config libc6-dev libssl-dev libexpat1-dev libqt4-dev -y



# OLD NOTES:
# 3.0.2 was released on 2016-04-28. It is the latest stable FFmpeg release from the 3.0 release branch, which was cut from master on 2016-02-14.
# Compile a recent ffmpeg (at least 2.0) if you need a FLAC encoder that handles 24-bit audio need to install libfdk-aac-dev libfdk-aac for Jessie - FFmpeg 3.0.2 "Einstein"
cd ~/Install
wget http://ffmpeg.org/releases/ffmpeg-3.0.2.tar.bz2
wget http://ffmpeg.org/releases/ffmpeg-3.0.2.tar.bz2.asc
gpg ffmpeg-3.0.2.tar.bz2.asc
gpg --keyserver pgpkeys.mit.edu --recv-key D67658D8
gpg ffmpeg-3.0.2.tar.bz2.asc
gpg --edit-key ffmpeg-devel@ffmpeg.org trust
5
y
q
gpg ffmpeg-3.0.2.tar.bz2.asc
gpg --verify ffmpeg-3.0.2.tar.bz2.asc
tar -jxvf ffmpeg-3.0.2.tar.bz2
cd ffmpeg-3.0.2
./configure --prefix=/tmp/ffmpeg --enable-static --disable-shared --enable-pic --disable-yasm --enable-libfdk-aac
# This may take a long time, depending on your computer CPU/HDD speed
make
sudo make install


ffmpeg -version
dpkg --list | grep ffmpeg
apt-cache policy ffmpeg
/usr/bin/ffmpeg -version
sudo ldconfig --version
make clean
make distclean (does not work on ALL programs but most) will remove ALL files made by "./configure" and ALL files made by "make".
make uninstall
sudo make uninstall

ls -ila /usr/share/doc/libavcodec*/RELEASE_NOTES






# Short OpenPGP key IDs are insecure, how to configure GnuPG to use long key IDs instead?
http://security.stackexchange.com/questions/84280/short-openpgp-key-ids-are-insecure-how-to-configure-gnupg-to-use-long-key-ids-i


fingerprint: 0D69 E11F 12BD BA07 7B37  26AB 4E1F 799A A4FF 2279
long id:                                                                    4E1F 799A A4FF 2279
short id:                                                                                     A4FF 2279


gpg --list-keys
gpg --search-keys D67658D8
gpg --keyid-format long --list-keys ffmpeg-devel@ffmpeg.org
gpg --fingerprint B4322F04D67658D8
gpg --with-colons --fingerprint B4322F04D67658D8
gpg --with-colons --fingerprint B4322F04D67658D8 | grep fpr | cut -d ':' -f 10

# To make sure GnuPG is always printing the long key ID, add the option to your ~/.gnupg/gpg.conf file stripping the --. For example, I have configured GnuPG to always print the 0x-prefixed long key ID by adding a line:
nano ~/.gnupg/gpg.conf
##############
keyid-format 0xlong

https://sourceforge.net/projects/dvdx/




https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anaglyph_3D
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stereoscopy

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    MKVToolNix – Matroska tools for Linux/Unix and Windows
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://mkvtoolnix.download/docs.html
https://mkvtoolnix.download/downloads.html#debian


# First import public GPG key all pools are signed:
wget -q -O - https://mkvtoolnix.download/gpg-pub-moritzbunkus.txt | sudo apt-key add -


# If you get the error msg below:
W: GPG error: http://mkvtoolnix.download ./ Release: The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY 74AF00ADF2E32C85
sudo apt-key adv --keyserver pgp.mit.edu --recv-keys 74AF00ADF2E32C85


sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list
########################################################################
# MKVToolNix – Matroska tools for Linux/Unix and Windows
deb http://mkvtoolnix.download/debian/jessie/ ./
deb-src http://mkvtoolnix.download/debian/jessie/ ./
########################################################################


sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-cache policy mkvtoolnix
sudo apt-get install mkvtoolnix mkvtoolnix-gui


# To UNinstall
sudo apt-get remove --purge mkvtoolnix mkvtoolnix-gui



# Spliting the MKV files to fit on FAT32 drive (4 GiB minus 1 byte or 4,294,967,295 (2n32 − 1) bytes of FAT32)
https://web.archive.org/web/20130114040933/http://www.my-guides.net/en/guides/general-video/how-to-split-mkv-files-using-mkvtoolnix
http://www.my-guides.net/en/guides/general-video/how-to-split-mkv-files-using-mkvtoolnix
4294967295 - 1 = 4294967294

4,294,967,295 bytes = 4.295 GB  (gigabytes) / 34.36 Gb  (gigabits) / 0.03436 Tb  (terabits) / 3.436×10^10 bits / 4 GiB  (gibibytes)
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigabyte


mkvinfo title00.mkv
mkvmerge --identify-verbose title00.mkv
mkvextract tracks The.Meaning.of.Life.mkv 1:title00.mkv.aac





MKV editor/cropper
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
mkvmerge -i Yes,-Prime-Minister-5.mkv

mkvmerge -v --split parts:-00:02:29,00:00:31- Yes,-Prime-Minister-5.mkv
mkvmerge -v -o output.mkv --title title --split parts:-00:02:29,00:00:31-

mkvmerge -v --split size:700m
mkvmerge -v --split size:3.9



mkvmerge --split 1G --compression 0:none --compression 1:none --clusters-in-meta-seek -o "output.mkv" "input.mkv"
mkvmerge -v --split parts:-00:02:29,00:00:31- --compression 0:none --compression 1:none --clusters-in-meta-seek -o "Yes,-Prime-Minister-5.TEST.mkv" "Yes,-Prime-Minister-5.mkv"
mkvmerge -v   -o "Yes,-Prime-Minister-5.TEST.mkv" "Yes,-Prime-Minister-5.mkv" --split parts:-00:02:29,00:00:31-


mkvmerge -v -o "TEST.mkv" "RT-HD-RT-Documentaries.2016-07-05.20-30.mkv" --split parts:00:06:42-00:19:24,00:21:36-00:31:59
mkvmerge -v -o "TEST.mkv" "RT-HD-RT-Documentaries.2016-07-05.20-30.mkv" --split parts:00:06:46-00:19:24,00:21:36-00:31:59

mkvmerge -v -o "TEST.mkv" "RT-HD-RT-Documentaries.2016-07-04.14-30.whos-saving-whom.III-IV.mkv" --split parts:00:02:28-00:15:07,00:17:13-00:30:11



mkvmerge -v -o "whos-saving-whom.II.mkv" "RT-HD-RT-Documentaries.2016-07-06.01-30.mkv" --split parts:00:14:50-00:27:27
mkvmerge -v -o "whos-saving-whom.I.mkv" "RT-HD-RT-Documentaries.2016-07-05.10-30.I-II-cut.HASMORE.mkv" --split parts:00:08:10-00:21:28




# Merge files - WORKING
mkvmerge -o newfile.mkv TEST-001.mkv +TEST-002.mkv
mkvmerge -o Whos-saving-whom.mkv whos-saving-whom.I.mkv +whos-saving-whom.II.mkv +whos-saving-whom.III.mkv +whos-saving-whom.IV.mkv




# Joining files with cat - TIME WRONG!
cat filename.mkv.* > filename.mkv
cat TEST-*.mkv > filename.mkv

########################################################################
#Package: *
#Pin: origin *.mkvtoolnix.download
#Pin-Priority: 751
########################################################################

https://squarepenguin.co.uk/forums/



# Update get_iplayer from GitHub
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/git/get_iplayer
git pull
./get_iplayer --help



01#
sudo apt-get autoremove libav-tools
sudo apt-get install libwww-perl libxml-simple-perl libmp3-tag-perl libmp3-info-perl libnet-smtp-ssl-perl libauthen-sasl-perl libnet-smtp-tls-butmaintained-perl rtmpdump atomicparsley git -y


02# Lets see where are what versions
sudo apt-cache policy ffmpeg

donald@SVP1121:~$ sudo apt-cache policy ffmpeg
ffmpeg:
  Installed: 10:2.8.7-dmo1~bpo8+2
  Candidate: 10:2.8.7-dmo1~bpo8+2
  Version table:
 *** 10:2.8.7-dmo1~bpo8+2 0
        500 http://www.deb-multimedia.org/ jessie-backports/main amd64 Packages
        100 /var/lib/dpkg/status
     10:2.6.8-dmo1 0
        500 http://www.deb-multimedia.org/ jessie/main amd64 Packages
     7:3.0.2-2~bpo8+1 0
        100 http://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian/ jessie-backports/main amd64 Packages

donald@SVP1121:~/Install$ sudo apt-cache policy ffmpeg
ffmpeg:
  Installed: 10:2.6.9-dmo1
  Candidate: 10:2.6.9-dmo1
  Version table:
 *** 10:2.6.9-dmo1 0
        500 http://www.deb-multimedia.org/ jessie/main amd64 Packages
        100 /var/lib/dpkg/status
     7:3.0.2-2~bpo8+1 0
        100 http://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian/ jessie-backports/main amd64 Packages


03# Install ffmpeg from jessie-backports
sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install ffmpeg


04# Remove any existing get-iplayer package if you upgrading:
sudo dpkg -r get-iplayer


05# Download latest release - use 06# Clone get_iplayer from GitHub
cd ~/Install
 wget http://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian/pool/main/g/get-iplayer/get-iplayer_2.94-1_all.deb
 sudo dpkg -i get-iplayer_2.94-1_all.deb


06# Clone get_iplayer from GitHub
cd ~/git
git clone git://github.com/get-iplayer/get_iplayer.git
cd get_iplayer
./get_iplayer --help


07# This also allows you to download the new HVF streams.
./get_iplayer --add-prefs --ffmpeg="/usr/bin/ffmpeg"
./get_iplayer --prefs-add --tvmode=best
./get_iplayer --prefs-add --radiomode=best


08# Completely clear all preferences in ~/.get_iplayer/options
./get_iplayer --prefs-clear

./get_iplayer --prefs-show
./get_iplayer --dump-options


09# Refresh the programme cache for all types:
./get_iplayer --refresh --type=all


10# Fists check what's available
# To download this video http://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b073m6g8/panorama-the-zika-baby-crisis
./get_iplayer --info --pid=b073m6g8


11# This command will download the Video in HD (720p is the max for iPlayer).
./get_iplayer --pid=b073m6g8 --modes=flashhd --type=tv --force --subtitles --subsraw --metadata=generic --thumb --thumbsize=6 --long --output=/home/donald/Videos/


12# Web PVR Manager (WPM) http://127.0.0.1:1935
./get_iplayer_web_pvr


13# Get Stream Info
./get_iplayer --info --pid=b07hk228 --streaminfo



# Akamai Technologies
# Limelight Networks
--exclude-supplier=akamai
--exclude-supplier=limelight






Max Res        Max Frame Rate    Max Bit Rate    Max Quality Configuration                Notes
1280x720    50fps            5Mbps            get_iplayer --prefs-add --tvmode=best    default
960x540        50fps            3Mbps            get_iplayer --prefs-add --tvmode=better     
1280x720    25fps            2.5Mbps            get_iplayer --prefs-add --tvmode=tv25fps     
960x540        25fps            1.7Mbps            get_iplayer --prefs-add --tvmode=vgood     
704x396        25fps            950kbps            get_iplayer --prefs-add --tvmode=good     
512x288        25fps            550kbps            get_iplayer --prefs-add --tvmode=worse     
384x216        25fps            340kbps            get_iplayer --prefs-add --tvmode=worst










# To download this video http://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b073m6g8/panorama-the-zika-baby-crisis
# Fists check what's available
./get_iplayer --info --pid=b073m6g8

# This command will download the Video in HD (720p is the max for iPlayer).
./get_iplayer --pid=b073m6g8 --modes=flashhd --type=tv --force --subtitles --subsraw --metadata=generic --thumb --thumbsize=6 --long --output=/home/donald/Videos/

--pid=b073m6g8 - PID of the program/video
--modes=flashhd - Download HD version
--type=tv - It's a TV program
--force - Force the download, maybe we had some, that did not download properly
--subtitles - Download subtitles
--subsraw - Download subtitles in raw format
--metadata=generic - Download metadata
--thumb - Download thumbnails
--thumbsize=6 - Download thumbnails size 6 (largest)
--long - Download long log
--output=/home/donald/Videos/ - Folder where this video will be stored

--file-prefix="<name>-<episode>_<pid>_<mode>"
--file-prefix="<nameshort>_<00seriesnum>-<00episodenum>_<episode>_<pid>_<mode>"








#NOTES
mismatched tag at line 1, column 3156, byte 3156 at /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/perl5/5.20/XML/Parser.pm line 187.
sudo apt --reinstall install libwww-perl libxml-simple-perl libmp3-tag-perl libmp3-info-perl libnet-smtp-ssl-perl libauthen-sasl-perl libnet-smtp-tls-butmaintained-perl

http://www.html-tidy.org/
https://packages.debian.org/jessie/tidy
sudo apt-get install tidy

tidy - HTML syntax checker and reformatter
