#     HandBrake - A tool to convert video from nearly any format to modern codecs
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://handbrake.fr/news.php
https://handbrake.fr/checksums.php
https://trac.handbrake.fr/wiki/HandBrake



https://github.com/HandBrake/HandBrake


# HandBrake - AAC Encode Change
https://forum.handbrake.fr/viewtopic.php?f=33&t=34143





# Install from repository - (0.9.9+svn6422+dfsg1-2)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://packages.debian.org/jessie/handbrake

# Let's see what's available
sudo apt-cache policy handbrake handbrake-cli


# To install
sudo apt-get install handbrake handbrake-cli





# Compiling HandBrake on Linux
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://trac.handbrake.fr/wiki/CompileOnLinux



# Install Dependencies
-------------------------------------------------------------
sudo apt-get install yasm build-essential \
autoconf libtool zlib1g-dev libbz2-dev libfribidi-dev \
intltool libglib2.0-dev libdbus-glib-1-dev libgtk2.0-dev \
libgudev-1.0-dev libwebkit-dev libnotify-dev \
libgstreamer0.10-dev libgstreamer-plugins-base0.10-dev \
libass-dev libtheora-dev libvorbis-dev libsamplerate0-dev


sudo apt-get install subversion yasm build-essential autoconf libtool \
zlib1g-dev libbz2-dev libogg-dev libtheora-dev libvorbis-dev \
libsamplerate-dev libxml2-dev libfribidi-dev libfreetype6-dev \
libfontconfig1-dev libass-dev intltool libglib2.0-dev libdbus-glib-1-dev \
libgtk2.0-dev libgudev-1.0-dev libwebkit-dev libnotify-dev \
libgstreamer0.10-dev libgstreamer-plugins-base0.10-dev libappindicator-dev


sudo apt-get install build-essential subversion yasm build-essential autoconf libtool zlib1g-dev libbz2-dev libogg-dev libtheora-dev libvorbis-dev libsamplerate-dev libxml2-dev libfribidi-dev libfreetype6-dev libfontconfig1-dev libass-dev intltool libglib2.0-dev libdbus-glib-1-dev libgtk2.0-dev libgudev-1.0-dev libwebkit-dev libnotify-dev libgstreamer0.10-dev libgstreamer-plugins-base0.10-dev libappindicator-de

sudo apt-get install subversion yasm build-essential autoconf libtool zlib1g-dev libbz2-dev libfribidi-dev intltool libglib2.0-dev libdbus-glib-1-dev libgtk-3-dev libgudev-1.0-dev libwebkit-dev libnotify-dev libgstreamer0.10-dev libgstreamer-plugins-base0.10-dev libvorbis-dev libass-dev libsamplerate-dev libogg-dev libtheora-dev libappindicator-dev cmake libx264-dev libmp3lame-dev pkgconf


sudo apt-get install subversion yasm build-essential autoconf libtool zlib1g-dev libbz2-dev libfribidi-dev intltool libglib2.0-dev libdbus-glib-1-dev libgtk-3-dev libgudev-1.0-dev libwebkit-dev libnotify-dev libgstreamer0.10-dev libgstreamer-plugins-base0.10-dev libvorbis-dev libass-dev libsamplerate-dev libogg-dev libtheora-dev libappindicator-dev cmake libx264-dev libmp3lame-dev pkgconf





# Install from Source Code
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://handbrake.fr/checksums.php
Current Version (0.10.5)
File                                         Size            SHA1
HandBrake-0.10.5.tar.bz2     10.4 MB     3685e3f216468c9c5627b794a79cda96d6913caf



1# Download the files to ~/Install folder/directory :) and check checksums
cd ~/Install
curl -O -k https://handbrake.fr/mirror/HandBrake-0.10.5.tar.bz2
sha1sum HandBrake-0.10.5.tar.bz2
# or
wget https://handbrake.fr/mirror/HandBrake-0.10.5.tar.bz2


2# Unzip
tar -xvjf HandBrake-0.10.5.tar.bz2
cd HandBrake-0.10.5
# or
bunzip2 HandBrake-0.10.5.tar.bz2
tar -xvf HandBrake-0.10.5.tar
cd HandBrake-0.10.5


3# Configure
./configure --launch

If you get the ERROR below, see 4#
########################################################################
  : ./stdio.h:477:1: error: 'gets' undeclared here (not in a function)
  :  _GL_WARN_ON_USE (gets, "gets is a security hole - use fgets instead");
  :  ^
  : Makefile:1401: recipe for target 'clean-temp.o' failed
  : make[4]: *** [clean-temp.o] Error 1
  : make[4]: Leaving directory '/home/donald/Install/HandBrake-0.10.5/build/contrib/m4/m4-1.4.16/lib'
  : Makefile:1196: recipe for target 'all' failed
  : make[3]: *** [all] Error 2
  : make[3]: Leaving directory '/home/donald/Install/HandBrake-0.10.5/build/contrib/m4/m4-1.4.16/lib'
  : Makefile:1131: recipe for target 'all-recursive' failed
  : make[2]: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
  : make[2]: Leaving directory '/home/donald/Install/HandBrake-0.10.5/build/contrib/m4/m4-1.4.16'
  : Makefile:1084: recipe for target 'all' failed
  : make[1]: *** [all] Error 2
  : make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/donald/Install/HandBrake-0.10.5/build/contrib/m4/m4-1.4.16'
  : ../contrib/m4/module.rules:2: recipe for target 'contrib/m4/.stamp.build' failed
  : make: *** [contrib/m4/.stamp.build] Error 2
########################################################################



4# To fix the error above, or others see "mattgadient.com #Working around hiccups when compiling Handbrake on Linux
nano ./contrib/m4/module.defs
########################################################################
$(eval $(call import.MODULE.defs,M4,m4))
$(eval $(call import.CONTRIB.defs,M4))

M4.FETCH.url = http://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/m4/m4-1.4.17.tar.bz2
M4.FETCH.md5 = 8a1787edcba75ae5cd1dc40d7d8ed03a
########################################################################



5# Lets try to configure command again with "--force" argument
./configure --launch --force



6# Install
cd ./build && sudo make install



#7 Launch this application
Alt+F2: /usr/local/bin/ghb
ghb











NOTES:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
$ sudo apt-cache policy handbrake
handbrake:
  Installed: (none)
  Candidate: 1:0.10.1-dmo3+1
  Version table:
     1:0.10.1-dmo3+1 0
        500 http://www.deb-multimedia.org/ jessie/main amd64 Packages
     0.9.9+svn6422+dfsg1-2 0
        500 http://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian/ jessie/main amd64 Packages




# Install from GIT
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/git
git clone https://github.com/HandBrake/HandBrake.git hb
cd hb
./configure --launch
# or HandBrakeCLI only:
./configure --launch --disable-gtk
cd build
sudo make install

#    Youtube-dl - youtubedl
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://rg3.github.io/youtube-dl/
https://rg3.github.io/youtube-dl/download.html
https://github.com/rg3/youtube-dl/blob/master/README.md#readme


# List of all the supported sites:
https://rg3.github.io/youtube-dl/supportedsites.html


The following GPG keys will be used to sign the binaries and the git tags:
Philipp Hagemeister 7D33 D762 FD6C 3513 0481 347F DB4B 54CB A482 6A18
Sergey M. ED7F 5BF4 6B3B BED8 1C87 368E 2C39 3E0F 18A9 236D



# Import and trust these GPG keys:
gpg --keyserver pool.sks-keyservers.net --recv-keys 0x7D33D762FD6C35130481347FDB4B54CBA4826A18
gpg --fingerprint 0x7D33D762FD6C35130481347FDB4B54CBA4826A18
gpg --keyserver pool.sks-keyservers.net --recv-keys 0xED7F5BF46B3BBED81C87368E2C393E0F18A9236D
gpg --fingerprint 0xED7F5BF46B3BBED81C87368E2C393E0F18A9236D

gpg --edit-key 0xED7F5BF46B3BBED81C87368E2C393E0F18A9236D trust

2016.10.02 (sig)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
SHA256: 88baa9aee107d593fe63798a64f917fbfd3047d6d7450bd89edd6a6ff24000d6

# Installation / Upgrade / Change file permission to make it executable with WGET
sudo wget https://yt-dl.org/downloads/latest/youtube-dl -O /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
sha256sum /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
sudo chmod a+rx /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl

sudo curl -L https://yt-dl.org/downloads/latest/youtube-dl -o /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
sha256sum /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
sudo chmod a+rx /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl


# Check the signature
cd ~/Install
sudo wget https://yt-dl.org/downloads/latest/youtube-dl.sig -O youtube-dl.sig
gpg --verify youtube-dl.sig /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
rm youtube-dl.sig


# Configuration
cat /etc/youtube-dl.conf
cat ~/.config/youtube-dl/config



# Download, replace space with dots, and remove diacritic marks :)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
nano files.txt
youtube-dl -v --console-title -f best --batch-file='files.txt'
for file in *; do mv "$file" `echo $file | tr ' ' '.'` ; done
detox $(pwd)


# Check available streams:
youtube-dl -F https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=47sj8xdjAsQ



# Download particular version / best available version:
cd ~/Videos
youtube-dl -f 140 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=47sj8xdjAsQ
youtube-dl -f best https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=47sj8xdjAsQ


# Download Video from YouTube
youtube-dl https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W4G1-JO71os
youtube-dl https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YRfpWk3cUiQ
youtube-dl -- -47sj8xdjAsQ

# To download a video list, copy all of the url in a text file and run following command:
youtube-dl -a <name_of_your_text_file.txt>

# Download BestAudio available:
youtube-dl -f bestaudio https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vU0fYzuypXg

# Or specify BestAudio as M4A
youtube-dl -f m4a bestaudio https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vU0fYzuypXg

# Download Audio version:
youtube-dl -f 140 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vU0fYzuypXg

format code  extension  resolution note
249          webm       audio only DASH audio   90k , opus @ 50k (48000Hz), 194.80MiB
250          webm       audio only DASH audio  109k , opus @ 70k (48000Hz), 278.10MiB
171          webm       audio only DASH audio  145k , vorbis@128k (44100Hz), 411.70MiB
140          m4a        audio only DASH audio  155k , m4a_dash container, mp4a.40.2@128k (44100Hz), 438.85MiB
251          webm       audio only DASH audio  172k , opus @160k (48000Hz), 524.80MiB


# M4AtoM4A
# Some audio players do not support DASH audio. For m4a, I had to demux it to make it a 'regular' m4a using ffmpeg:
ffmpeg -i input.m4a -vn -c:a copy output.m4a

# MP4toMP3
ffmpeg -i video.mp4 -f mp3 -ab 192000 -vn music.mp3


# Soundconverter
sudo apt-get install soundconverter


# WinFF
sudo apt-get install winff libavcodec-extra


#How can I convert audio from MP4 or FLV video files to mp3?
http://askubuntu.com/questions/80954/how-can-i-convert-audio-from-mp4-or-flv-video-files-to-mp3



ffmpeg.exe -i C:\Users\user\Videos\_tmp_video_1469742126713.mp4 -i C:\Users\user\Videos\_tmp_ao_1469742126713.mp3 -c:v copy -c:a copy C:\Users\user\Videos\1469742126713.mp4 -y
ffmpeg.exe -i _tmp_video_1469742126713.mp4 -i _tmp_ao_1469742126713.mp3 -c:v copy -c:a copy 1469742126713.mp4 -y


ffmpeg.exe -i C:\Users\user\Videos\_tmp_video_1469743389947.webm -i C:\Users\user\Videos\_tmp_ao_1469743389947.mp3 -c:v copy -c:a copy C:\Users\user\Videos\1469743389947.webm -y
ffmpeg.exe -i _tmp_video_1469743389947.webm -i _tmp_ao_1469743389947.mp3 -c:v copy -c:a copy 1469743389947.webm -y

# Convert from HTML to formatted plain text using Lynx
lynx --dump -listonly "URL-of-YouTube-webpage" > batch-file.txt

youtube-dl -f best --batch-file='batch-file.Autobazar.Monte.Karlo.txt'


nano batch-file.pohadky.txt

# Import GPG keys

# To check the signature:
cd ~/Install
wget https://yt-dl.org/downloads/2016.06.14/youtube-dl.sig -O youtube-dl.sig
gpg --verify youtube-dl.sig /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
rm youtube-dl.sig


# Installation / Upgrade / Change file permission to make it executable with WGET
sudo wget https://yt-dl.org/downloads/2016.06.14/youtube-dl -O /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
sha256sum /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
sudo chmod a+rx /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl


# Installation / Upgrade / Change file permission to make it executable with CURL
sudo curl -L https://yt-dl.org/downloads/2016.06.14/youtube-dl -o /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
sha256sum /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
sudo chmod a+rx /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl




 sudo curl https://yt-dl.org/latest/youtube-dl -o /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
sudo chmod a+rx /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl

#    MediaInfo
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://mediaarea.net/en/MediaInfo/Download/Debian
https://packages.debian.org/jessie/mediainfo


sudo apt-cache policy mediainfo
sudo apt-cache rdepends mediainfo
sudo apt-cache search mediainfo
sudo apt-show-versions mediainfo
sudo aptitude show mediainfo



# To upgrade first remove old packages
sudo dpkg -r libmediainfo0
sudo dpkg -r mediainfo
sudo dpkg -r mediainfo-gui



# Debian 8 (Jessie), amd64 - v0.7.89
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install
curl -O http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/mediainfo-gui/0.7.89/mediainfo-gui_0.7.89-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb -O http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/mediainfo/0.7.89/mediainfo_0.7.89-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb -O http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/libmediainfo0/0.7.89/libmediainfo0_0.7.89-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb -O http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/libzen0/0.4.33/libzen0_0.4.33-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb

http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/mediainfo-gui/0.7.89/mediainfo-gui_0.7.89-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb
http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/mediainfo/0.7.89/mediainfo_0.7.89-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb
http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/libmediainfo0/0.7.89/libmediainfo0_0.7.89-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb
http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/libzen0/0.4.33/libzen0_0.4.33-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb

sudo apt-get install libwxbase3.0-0 libwxgtk3.0-0 -y
sudo dpkg -i libzen0_0.4.33-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo dpkg -i libmediainfo0_0.7.89-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo dpkg -i mediainfo_0.7.89-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo dpkg -i mediainfo-gui_0.7.89-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo apt-get -f install





# Debian 8 (Jessie), amd64 - v0.7.87
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install
curl -O http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/mediainfo-gui/0.7.87/mediainfo-gui_0.7.87-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb -O http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/mediainfo/0.7.87/mediainfo_0.7.87-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb -O http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/libmediainfo0/0.7.87/libmediainfo0_0.7.87-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb -O http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/libzen0/0.4.33/libzen0_0.4.33-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb

sudo apt-get install libwxbase3.0-0 libwxgtk3.0-0 -y
sudo dpkg -i libzen0_0.4.33-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo dpkg -i libmediainfo0_0.7.87-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb

sudo dpkg -i mediainfo-gui_0.7.87-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb

# Debian 8 (Jessie), amd64- v0.7.86

# Debian 8.0 (Jessie), amd64 - 0.7.85

wget http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/libmediainfo0/0.7.84/libmediainfo0_0.7.84-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb
wget http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/mediainfo/0.7.84/mediainfo_0.7.84-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb
wget http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/mediainfo-gui/0.7.84/mediainfo-gui_0.7.84-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb

sudo dpkg -i libmediainfo0_0.7.84-1_amd64.Debian_8.0.deb

#  Debian 8.0 (Jessie), i386 32-bit - 0.7.84
------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install
wget http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/libzen0/0.4.33/libzen0_0.4.33-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
wget http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/libmediainfo0/0.7.84/libmediainfo0_0.7.84-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
wget http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/mediainfo/0.7.84/mediainfo_0.7.84-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
wget http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/mediainfo-gui/0.7.84/mediainfo-gui_0.7.84-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo dpkg -i libzen0_0.4.33-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo dpkg -i libmediainfo0_0.7.84-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo dpkg -i mediainfo_0.7.84-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo dpkg -i mediainfo-gui_0.7.84-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb


# 32-bit - i386 / i686 - v0.7.83 - Debian 8.0 (Jessie), i386
------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install
sudo apt-get install libwxbase3.0-0
wget http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/mediainfo-gui/0.7.83/mediainfo-gui_0.7.83-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
wget http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/mediainfo/0.7.83/mediainfo_0.7.83-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
wget http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/libmediainfo0/0.7.83/libmediainfo0_0.7.83-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
wget http://mediaarea.net/download/binary/libzen0/0.4.33/libzen0_0.4.33-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo dpkg -i libzen0_0.4.33-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo dpkg -i libmediainfo0_0.7.83-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo dpkg -i mediainfo_0.7.83-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb
sudo dpkg -i mediainfo-gui_0.7.83-1_i386.Debian_8.0.deb

Back to Top...
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    Firewall - Shorewall_IPv4 - Debian Jessie
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://packages.debian.org/jessie/shorewall


sudo apt-cache policy shorewall
sudo apt-cache rdepends shorewall
sudo apt-cache search shorewall
sudo apt-show-versions shorewall



sudo apt-get install shorewall shorewall-doc -y
cd /etc/shorewall






sudo nano /etc/default/shorewall
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
startup=1
######################################################################################################################################################################################################





sudo nano /etc/shorewall/zones
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# zones — Shorewall zone declaration file
# http://shorewall.net/manpages/shorewall-zones.html
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#ZONE   TYPE            OPTIONS         IN                      OUT
#-        -                -                 OPTIONS                 OPTIONS
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
fw      firewall
net     ipv4
######################################################################################################################################################################################################







sudo nano /etc/shorewall/policy
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# policy — Shorewall policy file
# http://shorewall.net/manpages/shorewall-policy.html
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#SOURCE        DEST    POLICY        LOG            BURST:LIMIT
#-            -        -            LEVEL        -
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# ACCEPT all connections from this machine "to Internet"
$FW            net        ACCEPT
#
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# DROP all "from Internet" to this machine
net            all        DROP        info
#
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# The FOLLOWING POLICY MUST BE LAST - The FOLLOWING POLICY MUST BE LAST - The FOLLOWING POLICY MUST BE LAST - The FOLLOWING POLICY MUST BE LAST - The FOLLOWING POLICY MUST BE LAST
all         all        REJECT        info
######################################################################################################################################################################################################








sudo nano /etc/shorewall/interfaces
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# interfaces — Shorewall interfaces file
# http://shorewall.net/manpages/shorewall-interfaces.html
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# FORMAT 2 - The BROADCAST column is omitted.
?FORMAT 2
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#ZONE    INTERFACE        OPTIONS
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
net            eth0            tcpflags,blacklist,logmartians,nosmurfs,routeback,routefilter
net            wlan0            tcpflags,blacklist,logmartians,nosmurfs,routeback,routefilter
#
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# OPTIONS
# tcpflags[={0|1}]        Packets arriving on this interface are checked for certain illegal combinations of TCP flags.
# blacklist             Check packets arriving on this interface against the shorewall6-blacklist(5) file.
# logmartians[={0|1}]    Turn on kernel martian logging (logging of packets with impossible source addresses. It is strongly suggested that if you set routefilter on an interface that you also set logmartians
# nosmurfs                Filter packets for smurfs (packets with a broadcast address as the source).
# routeback[={0|1}]        If specified, indicates that Shorewall should include rules that allow traffic arriving on this interface to be routed back out that same interface. This option is also required
#                        when you have used a wildcard in the INTERFACE column if you want to allow traffic between the interfaces that match the wildcard.
# routefilter[={0|1|2}]    Turn on kernel route filtering for this interface (anti-spoofing measure).
######################################################################################################################################################################################################







sudo nano /etc/shorewall/blacklist
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# blacklist — Shorewall Blacklist file
# http://shorewall.net/manpages/shorewall-blacklist.html
#
# Make sure "shorewall/interfaces" contains Blacklist
#
# sudo shorewall list blacklst
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#ADDRESS/SUBNET         PROTOCOL        PORT
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
-                       udp             1024:1033,1434
-                       tcp             57,1433,1434,2401,2745,3127,3306,3410,4899,5554,6101,8081,9898
######################################################################################################################################################################################################









sudo nano /etc/shorewall/rules
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# rules — Shorewall rules file
# /etc/shorewall/rules
# http://shorewall.net/manpages/shorewall-rules.html
# https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_TCP_and_UDP_port_numbers
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#ACTION        SOURCE                      DEST            PROTO    DEST    SOURCE          ORIGINAL        RATE            USER/   MARK    CONNLIMIT       TIME    HEADERS         SWITCH          HELPER
#-            -                            -                -       PORT    PORT(S)         DEST            LIMIT           GROUP
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#SECTION ALL
#SECTION ESTABLISHED
#SECTION RELATED
?SECTION NEW

# BLACKLIST section
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
DROP        net:5.134.216.0/21            $FW   
DROP        net:5.135.0.0/16            $FW   
DROP        net:12.0.0.0/8                $FW   
DROP        net:23.228.64.0/18            $FW
DROP        net:31.184.195.0/24            $FW  # PIN-DATACENTER-NET, RU

DROP        net:43.229.52.0/22            $FW   
DROP        net:45.35.16.0/20            $FW   
DROP        net:46.148.16.0/20            $FW

DROP        net:222.184.0.0/13            $FW   
DROP        net:222.241.128.0/18        $FW   
#DROP        net:            $FW
#DROP        net:            $FW
#DROP        net:            $FW
#DROP        net:            $FW
#DROP        net:            $FW
#
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#ACTION        SOURCE                      DEST            PROTO    DEST    SOURCE          ORIGINAL        RATE            USER/   MARK    CONNLIMIT       TIME    HEADERS         SWITCH          HELPER
#-            -                            -                -       PORT    PORT(S)         DEST            LIMIT           GROUP
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# Allow SSH connection from the Internet to this machine
# SSH - port 110
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
ACCEPT        net:2.29.0.0/16                 $FW             tcp     110             # Orange WBC Broadband / EE Route
ACCEPT        net:92.40.0.0/15            $FW             tcp     110             # H3GUK - Three.co.uk
ACCEPT        net:94.196.0.0/15           $FW             tcp     110             # H3GUK - Three.co.uk
ACCEPT        net:188.28.0.0/14           $FW             tcp     110             # H3GUK - Three.co.uk 188.28.0.0/188.30.255.255
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# Allow MOSH connection from the Internet to this machine
# MOSH - ports 60000 to 61000.
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
ACCEPT        net:2.29.0.0/16                 $FW             udp     60000:61000             # Orange WBC Broadband / EE Route
ACCEPT        net:92.40.0.0/15            $FW             udp     60000:61000             # H3GUK - Three.co.uk
ACCEPT        net:94.196.0.0/15           $FW             udp     60000:61000             # H3GUK - Three.co.uk
ACCEPT        net:188.28.0.0/14           $FW             udp     60000:61000             # H3GUK - Three.co.uk 188.28.0.0/188.30.255.255
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# WEB http/https
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
ACCEPT        all                           all              tcp    80
ACCEPT        all                           all              tcp    443
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# MiniDLNA TCP="8200" / OPEN_UDP="1900"
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
ACCEPT        net:192.168.1.0/24     $FW             tcp    8200
ACCEPT        net:192.168.1.0/24     $FW             udp    1900
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# MPD TCP="6600"
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
ACCEPT        net:192.168.1.0/24     $FW             tcp    6600
######################################################################################################################################################################################################




sudo shorewall restart
sudo shorewall check
sudo shorewall -v2 check
sudo shorewall status
sudo shorewall show
sudo shorewall show capabilities
sudo shorewall show policies
sudo shorewall show connections
sudo shorewall show -x
sudo shorewall show dynamic
sudo shorewall safe-start
sudo shorewall safe-restart
sudo shorewall list blacklst
sudo shorewall hits
sudo shorewall logwatch


sudo tail -f /var/log/messages


sudo service shorewall start
sudo service shorewall status


sudo systemctl status shorewall.service
sudo systemctl status shorewall6.service








OpenVPN
sudo iptables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -s 172.22.172.0/25 -j SNAT --to-source 1xx.8x.1xx.1xx
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
sudo iptables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -s 172.22.172.0/25 -o venet0 -j SNAT --to-source 1xx.8x.1xx.1xx

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    Firewall - Shorewall_IPv6 - Debian Jessie
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://shorewall.net/manpages6/


sudo apt-get install shorewall6




sudo nano /etc/default/shorewall6
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
startup=1
######################################################################################################################################################################################################





sudo nano /etc/shorewall6/zones
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# zones — Shorewall6 zone declaration file
# /etc/shorewall6/zones
# http://shorewall.net/manpages6/shorewall6-zones.html
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#ZONE   TYPE            OPTIONS         IN                      OUT
#-        -                -                OPTIONS                    OPTIONS
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
fw      firewall
net     ipv6
######################################################################################################################################################################################################







sudo nano /etc/shorewall6/policy
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# policy — shorewall6 policy file
# /etc/shorewall6/policy
# http://shorewall.net/manpages6/shorewall6-policy.html
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#SOURCE        DEST    POLICY        LOG        BURST:LIMIT
#-            -        -            LEVEL    -
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# ACCEPT all connections from this machine "to Internet"
$FW            net        ACCEPT
#
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# DROP all "from Internet" to this machine
net            all        DROP        info
#
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# The FOLLOWING POLICY MUST BE LAST
all         all        REJECT        info
#
######################################################################################################################################################################################################






sudo nano /etc/shorewall6/interfaces
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# interfaces — shorewall6 interfaces file
# /etc/shorewall6/interfaces
# http://shorewall.net/manpages6/shorewall6-interfaces.html
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# FORMAT 2 - The BROADCAST column is omitted.
?FORMAT 2
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#ZONE    INTERFACE        OPTIONS
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
net        eth0            tcpflags,blacklist ##### NOT IN IPv6,logmartians,nosmurfs
net        wlan0            tcpflags,blacklist ##### NOT IN IPv6,logmartians,nosmurfs
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# OPTIONS blacklist:     Check packets arriving on this interface against the shorewall6-blacklist(5) file.
# OPTIONS tcpflags:        Packets arriving on this interface are checked for certain illegal combinations of TCP flags.
######################################################################################################################################################################################################







sudo nano /etc/shorewall6/blacklist
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# blacklist — shorewall6 Blacklist file
# /etc/shorewall6/blacklist
# http://shorewall.net/manpages6/shorewall6-blacklist.html
#
# Make sure "/etc/shorewall6/interfaces" contains "blacklist" OPTION
#
# sudo shorewall6 list blacklst
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#ADDRESS/SUBNET         PROTOCOL        PORT
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
-                       udp             1024:1033,1434
-                       tcp             57,1433,1434,2401,2745,3127,3306,3410,4899,5554,6101,8081,9898
######################################################################################################################################################################################################









sudo nano /etc/shorewall6/rules
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# rules — Shorewall6 rules file
# /etc/shorewall6/rules
# http://shorewall.net/manpages6/shorewall6-rules.html
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#ACTION        SOURCE                      DEST            PROTO    DEST    SOURCE          ORIGINAL        RATE            USER/   MARK    CONNLIMIT       TIME    HEADERS        SWITCH        HELPER
#-            -                            -                -       PORT    PORT(S)         DEST            LIMIT           GROUP
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#SECTION ALL
#SECTION ESTABLISHED
#SECTION RELATED
?SECTION NEW
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# BLACKLIST section
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#DROP        net:            $FW
#DROP        net:            $FW
#DROP        net:            $FW
#DROP        net:            $FW
#DROP        net:            $FW
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# Allow SSH connection from the Internet to this machine
# SSH - port 110
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
ACCEPT        net:2001:470:b:227::1        $FW             tcp     110             #
ACCEPT        net:2001:8a0:11da::/48       $FW            tcp    110                #
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# Allow MOSH connection from the Internet to this machine
# MOSH - ports 60000 to 61000.
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#ACCEPT        net:2001:470:b:227::1                 $FW             udp     60000:61000            
#ACCEPT        2001:8a0:11da::/48                 $FW             udp     60000:61000           
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# OpenVPN - default port!
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
#ACCEPT        net                           $FW              udp        1194
#ACCEPT        $FW                           net              udp        -       1194
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
# WEB
######################################################################################################################################################################################################
ACCEPT        all                           all              tcp    80
ACCEPT        all                           all              tcp    443
######################################################################################################################################################################################################



sudo shorewall6 restart
sudo shorewall6 check
sudo shorewall6 -v2 check
sudo shorewall6 status
sudo shorewall6 show
sudo shorewall6 show capabilities
sudo shorewall6 show policies
sudo shorewall6 show connections
sudo shorewall6 show -x
sudo shorewall6 show dynamic
sudo shorewall6 list blacklst
sudo shorewall6 safe-start
sudo shorewall6 safe-restart
sudo shorewall6 logwatch



sudo service shorewall6 start
sudo service shorewall6 status





sudo shorewall6 open all 2001:470:b:227::1 tcp 22
sudo shorewall6 close all 2001:470:b:227::1 tcp 22




sudo shorewall6 drop
sudo shorewall6 drop
sudo shorewall6 drop
sudo shorewall6 drop 2002:277b:caf3::277b:caf3
sudo shorewall6 show dynamic



sudo sysctl -w net.ipv6.conf.all.forwarding=1




shorewall6 logwatch -- -30
shorewall6 open all 2001:470:b:227::1 tcp 22



ls -ils /usr/share/doc/shorewall/default-config
ls -ila /usr/share/doc/shorewall/examples/one-interface



flush
----------------------
iptables -L -v
iptables -F
iptables -X
iptables -t nat -F
iptables -t nat -X
iptables -t mangle -F
iptables -t mangle -X






service shorewall status
service shorewall start

service shorewall6 status
service shorewall6 start

shorewall logwatch
shorewall6 logwatch

shorewall6 check
shorewall6 show capabilities
shorewall6 show policies
shorewall6 show connections
shorewall6 show -x


shorewall show connections
shorewall6 show connections

##  Hard Disk Sentinel_64-bit Linux console version - executable, zip-compressed
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.hdsentinel.com/hard_disk_sentinel_linux.php




# 64-bit - 0.16
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install;mkdir ~/Install/HDR-016
wget http://www.hdsentinel.com/hdslin/hdsentinel-016-x64.tar.gz
tar -xvzf hdsentinel-016-x64.tar.gz -C ~/Install/HDR-016
cd ~/Install/HDR-016
chmod 755 HDSentinel
sudo ./HDSentinel




# 64-bit 0.08
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install; mkdir HDS
wget http://www.hdsentinel.com/hdslin/hdsentinel_008_x64.zip
unzip hdsentinel_008_x64.zip -d ~/Install/HDS
cd HDS
chmod 755 HDSentinel
sudo ./HDSentinel
sudo ./HDSentinel <options>

#    Hard Disk Sentinel_32-bit Linux console version - executable, zip-compressed  - 64-bit BELOW!!!!!

""""" The user must be root to use this software or start it with sudo. """""




32-bit
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hard Disk Sentinel 32-bit Linux console version - executable, zip-compressed
cd ~Install; mkdir HDS
wget http://www.hdsentinel.com/hdslin/hdsentinel_008.zip
unzip hdsentinel_008.zip -d ~/Install/HDS
cd HDS
chmod 755 HDSentinel
sudo ./HDSentinel
sudo ./HDSentinel <options>


Command line switches

The switches are NOT case sensitive. Upper and lower case can be used to specify them.

    -h - displays help and usage information
    -r [report file] - automatically save report to filename (default: report.txt)
    -dump - dump report to stdout (can be used with -xml to dump XML output instead of text)
    -xml - create and save XML report instead of TXT
    -solid - solid output (drive, tempC, health%, power on hours, model, S/N, size)
    -verbose - detailed detection information and save temporary files (only for debug purposes)
    -aam - display acoustic management settings (current and recommended level)
    -setaam drive_num|ALL level(hex)80-FE|QUIET|LOUD - set acoustic level on drive 0..n (or all)
    80 or QUIET is the lowest (most silent) setting, FE or LOUD is the highest (fastest) setting
    For example: hdsentinel -setaam 0 loud - Configures drive 0 to fastest (loud) setting. Same as hdsentinel -setaam 0 FE
   





~/Install/HDS$ sudo ./HDSentinel
Hard Disk Sentinel for LINUX console 0.08 (c) 2008-2011 info@hdsentinel.com
Start with -r [reportfile] to save data to report, -h for help

#    Add CACert.org to your system
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ca-cacert (2011.0523-2~bpo8+1) https://packages.debian.org/jessie-backports/ca-cacert - CAcert.org root certificates
sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install ca-cacert


# Debian root keys manual install
sudo mkdir /usr/local/share/ca-certificates/cacert.org
sudo wget -P /usr/local/share/ca-certificates/cacert.org http://www.cacert.org/certs/root.crt http://www.cacert.org/certs/class3.crt
sudo dpkg-reconfigure ca-certificates



Back to Top...
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    Remove a "CA" certificate from your system
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo dpkg-reconfigure ca-certificates


sudo cat /etc/ca-certificates.conf

# or edit manually
sudo nano /etc/ca-certificates.conf
########################################################################
delete untrusted certificates
########################################################################
sudo update-ca-certificates

Copyright (C) 2001-2005  |  jigdo@
Richard Atterer          |  atterer.net
Getting mirror information from /etc/apt/sources.list

To resume a half-finished download, enter name of .jigdo file.
To start a new download, enter URL of .jigdo file.
You can also enter several URLs/filenames, separated with spaces,
or enumerate in {}, e.g. `http://server/cd-{1_NONUS,2,3}.jigdo'

#    Telegram – a new era of messaging - telegramim

# 64-bit
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install
wget https://updates.tdesktop.com/tlinux/tsetup.0.10.11.tar.xz
sudo tar -xJvf tsetup.0.10.11.tar.xz -C /usr/local/
cd /usr/local/Telegram
wget https://desktop.telegram.org/img/td_logo.png
./Telegram
./Telegram -startintray


Alt+F2: /usr/local/Telegram/Telegram -startintray




# 32-bit
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install
wget https://updates.tdesktop.com/tlinux32/tsetup32.0.10.11.tar.xz
sudo tar -xJvf tsetup32.0.10.11.tar.xz -C /usr/local/
cd /usr/local/Telegram
wget https://desktop.telegram.org/img/td_logo.png
./Telegram
./Telegram -startintray




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Telegram Desktop Icon / Shortcut
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
NOT AS ROOT!!! create as user who will execute!!!


nano ~/Desktop/Telegram.desktop
########################################################################
#!/usr/bin/env xdg-open
[Desktop Entry]
Encoding=UTF-8
Version=1.0
Type=Application
Terminal=false
Icon[en_GB]=/usr/local/Telegram/Telegram/td_logo.png
Name[en_GB]=Telegram
Comment[en_GB]=Telegram – a new era of messaging
Exec=/usr/local/Telegram/Telegram
Name=Telegram
Comment=Telegram – a new era of messaging
Icon=/usr/local/Telegram/td_logo.png
########################################################################
chmod 755 ~/Desktop/Telegram.desktop




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Add it to starup Apps preferences
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Alt+F2:    mate-session-properties


Startup Applications Preferences
Add Startup Program:
Name:        Telegram Desktop
Command:    /usr/local/Telegram/Telegram -startintray
Comment:    Telegram is a cloud-based mobile and desktop messaging app with a focus on security and speed.




TELEGRAM_NOTES:
========================================================================
start telegram minimised
start telegram minimised
start telegram in system tray

https://github.com/telegramdesktop/tdesktop/issues/407
https://github.com/telegramdesktop/tdesktop/issues/422
https://github.com/telegramdesktop/tdesktop/issues/948


-startintray
/opt/telegram/Telegram -startintray

/home/zuzana/Telegram/Telegram
/home/zuzana/Telegram/Telegram -startintray



http://linuxg.net/how-to-install-telegram-desktop-0-8-11-on-linux-systems/




/usr/local/Telegram/Telegram -startintray


(And note that "folder" is not the preferred UNIX / Linux terminology. They have been called "directories" in the UNIX context since Day 1.)
sudo tar -xJvf tsetup.0.9.49.tar.xz -C /opt/


http://www.tldp.org/LDP/Linux-Filesystem-Hierarchy/html/opt.html
/opt - OPTional


# 64-bit - OLD
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install
wget https://tdesktop.com/linux
curl -O https://tdesktop.com/linux
# Check the versin being downloaded from the wget log displayed
mv linux tsetup.0.9.49.tar.xz
tar -xJvf tsetup.0.9.49.tar.xz -C ~/
cd ~/Telegram
wget https://desktop.telegram.org/img/td_logo.png
./Telegram


# Change "donald" to your username in:
Icon[en_GB]=/home/donald/Telegram/td_logo.png
Exec=/home/donald/Telegram/Telegram
Icon=/home/donald/Telegram/td_logo.png

#    Viber - 64-bit ONLY
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.viber.com/en/products/linux
http://www.viber.com/en/terms
http://www.viber.com/en/privacypolicy.html


1# First install old version otherwise you get the "#1 Error" below and get Viber registered on you Mobile Phone
## (receive authentication code) that does not work with version 6.x.x.x
cd ~/Install
wget viber.v4.2.2.6.deb
sudo dpkg -i viber.v4.2.2.6.deb

# My not have to do it, try installing new version over the old one.
killall -9 viber
sudo dpkg -r viber

2# Install new version that supports msg. encryption etc.
cd ~/Install
wget http://download.cdn.viber.com/cdn/desktop/Linux/viber.deb
sudo dpkg --info viber.deb
sudo dpkg -c viber.deb
sudo dpkg -i viber.deb
mv viber.deb viber.v6.0.1.5.deb

#Install missing packages if you get "#2 Error" msg. [1]
sudo apt-get install libxcb-xkb1 libxcb-icccm4 libxcb-image0 libxcb-render-util0


# Add to start-up files / Minimized (does not work to systray)
Alt+F2: mate-session-properties / System ->Preferences -> Startup Applications

Name:            Viber
Command:    /opt/viber/Viber StartMinimized
Comment:    Viber VoIP and messenger




#1 Error
An Internet connection is required to
activate your Viber account. Check your
connection and try again.


#2 Error
This application failed to start because it could not find or load the Qt platform plugin "xcb".





#NOTES
[1] http://stackoverflow.com/a/37889181
ls -ila ~/.ViberPC
rm -rf ~/.ViberPC

mv viber.deb viber.v4.2.2.6.deb


Installation in pictures v 4.2.2.6 ...... well outdated guide!
https://support.viber.com/customer/portal/articles/1435703-viber-setup-for-linux

Resource:             (left this blank as default)
Password:             mypassword

Connect port:             5222 (default)
Connect server:         talk.google.com
File transfer proxie:    proxy.eu.jabber.org
BOSH URL:                empty

Wheezy - GNOME:

Command:    pidgin or /usr/bin/pidgin or /usr/lib/pidgin

#    Skype - 32-bit ONLY / i386
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.skype.com/en/download-skype/skype-for-linux/
https://wiki.debian.org/skype#Debian_8_.22Jessie.22



# Add Multiarch on your 64-bit system
sudo dpkg --add-architecture i386
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade


cd ~/Install
curl -O https://download.skype.com/linux/skype-debian_4.3.0.37-1_i386.deb
sudo dpkg --info skype-debian_4.3.0.37-1_i386.deb
sudo dpkg -i skype-debian_4.3.0.37-1_i386.deb
sudo apt-get -f install
# Make a test call
skype --callto echo123


# Look inside
sudo dpkg -c skype-debian_4.3.0.37-1_i386.deb






# OLD NOTES
wget -o skype-install.deb http://www.skype.com/go/getskype-linux-deb
sudo dpkg --info skype-install.deb
sudo dpkg -c skype-install.deb
sudo dpkg -i skype-install.deb
sudo apt-get -f install

# Check from the log version installed and them rename
mv skype-install.deb skype-install-4.3.0.37-1.deb



https://www.skype.com/en/download-skype/skype-for-linux/downloading/?type=debian32
https://get.skype.com/go/getskype-linux-deb-32
https://download.skype.com/linux/skype-debian_4.3.0.37-1_i386.deb


https://www.skype.com/en/download-skype/skype-for-linux/downloading/?type=dynamic

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    X Server - X11 - X - X Windows System - X.Org
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The X.Org project provides an open source implementation of the X Window System. The development work is being done in conjunction with the freedesktop.org community.
https://www.x.org/wiki/


https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X_Window_System

https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Start_X_at_login


# Stop X Server systemd = Ctrl+Alt+F1
sudo systemctl stop lightdm.service
sudo systemctl stop gdm.service
sudo systemctl stop kdm.service
Or use "start" or "restart" in place of "stop" when appropriate.


# Manually start X Server = Ctrl+Alt+F7
startx


# Stop X Server sysvinit = Ctrl+Alt+F1 / Ctrl+Alt+F7
sudo service lightdm stop
sudo service gdm stop
sudo service kdm stop
Or use start or restart in place of stop when appropriate.


# Disable starting X-server on boot
sudo update-rc.d <daemon> disable
sudo update-rc.d lightdm disable




http://www.linuxexpres.cz/software/graficke-prostredia-gnu-linux-1-2-x-dm
http://www.linuxexpres.cz/software/graficke-prostredia-gnu-linux-2-2-wm-de
http://www.linuxexpres.cz/software/graficke-prostredia-gnu-linux-3-3-dalsia-davka-prostredi

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    Upgrade BIOS on Dell PC/Laptop from terminal / shell
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
libsmbios-bin - Virtual Package
libsmbios2 - https://packages.debian.org/jessie/libsmbios2 Provide access to (SM)BIOS information -- dynamic library
smbios-utils - https://packages.debian.org/jessie/smbios-utils Provide access to (SM)BIOS information -- utility binaries

sudo apt-get install libsmbios-bin libsmbios2


# Dell Latitude E4200 System BIOS, A22 to A24
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/Install
wget http://downloads.dell.com/FOLDER01530523M/1/E4200A24.exe
sha256sum E4200A24.exe

MD5:ce320bd46261ffb19216f4518fc421ae
SHA1:3c933679c290921cbe6bfba89821d58d95a4bf36
SHA-256:d0921317ec733579ff1b74cb2eae1f5d53ad1beb8bc350439b031d2ccf88e579


# In GUI will come up with OK msg. / can be done in shell only. This will extract the *.hdr file
wine E4200A24.exe -writehdrfile -nopause


sudo dellBiosUpdate --version
sudo dellBiosUpdate --system-info
sudo dellBiosUpdate --test -f E4200A24.hdr
sudo dellBiosUpdate --hdr-info=E4200A24.hdr
sudo dellBiosUpdate --help
sudo dellBiosUpdate -u -f E4200A24.hdr --verbose --reboot








# Dell Inspiron 2200 System BIOS, A07 --------- BAD POWER SUPPLY!!!!!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
wget http://downloads.dell.com/bios/I2200A07.EXE
wget http://downloads.dell.com/bios/I2200A07.TXT

# In GUI will come up with OK msg. / can be done in shell only.
wine I2200A07.EXE -writehdrfile -nopause

sudo dellBiosUpdate --system-info
sudo dellBiosUpdate --version
sudo dellBiosUpdate --test -f I2200A07.hdr
sudo dellBiosUpdate --hdr-info=I2200A07.hdr
sudo dellBiosUpdate -u -f I2200A07.hdr --reboot
sudo reboot

sudo apt-get install asciinema -y


# To start recording
asciinema rec

# To finish recording hit

Back to Top...
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    Modify File Permissions with chmod / Changing File Ownership with chown - TODO
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://www.linode.com/docs/tools-reference/modify-file-permissions-with-chmod
https://www.linode.com/docs/tools-reference/linux-users-and-groups


ls -lha

d indicates that the object is a directory.
- indicates that the object is a normal file.
l indicates that the object is a symbolic link.



# Viewing File Permissions:
ls -l <directory/file>
# To view file permissions and ownership on files and directories
ls -al
-a option is to show hidden files or all files
-l option is for the long listing

The first column with the ten letters and dashes shows the permissions of the file or directory.
The second column (with the single number) indicates the number of files or directories contained in the directory.
The next column indicates the owner, followed by the group name, the size, date, and time of last access, and finally the name of the file.

drwxr-xr-x 2 user user 4096 Jan  9 10:11 documents
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user  675 Jan  7 12:05 .profile
drwxr-xr-x 4 user user 4096 Jan  7 14:55 public

``drwxr-xr-x`` are the permissions
``2`` is the number of files or directories
``user`` is the owner
``user`` is the group
``4096`` is the size
``Jan  9 10:11`` is the date/time of last access
``documents`` is the directory

Since a directory itself is a file, any directory will always show 4096 as it’s size. This does not reflect the size of the contents of the directory.



# To make a directory:
mkdir <directory name>
man mkdir


# To make a directory and set the permissions at the same time:
mkdir -m a=rwx <directory name>
-m option is short for mode
a=rwx means that all users have read, write, and execute permissions on the directory.


# To remove a file:
rm <file>


# To remove a directory:
rm -r <directory name>


# To change permissions on files and directories.
# The command chmod is short for change mode

Letter    Permission
r    Read
w    Write
x    Execute
X    Execute (only if file is a directory)
s    Set user or group ID on execution
t    Save program text on swap device
u    Current permissions the file has for owner
g    Current permissions the file has for users in the same group
o    Current permissions the file has for others not in the group





# Changing File Ownership
chown user:group /path/to/file


# Change the ownership of a directory and all the files contained inside, use the recursive option:
chown -R cjones:marketing /srv/smb/leadership/









Back to Top...

Back to Top...
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    apt-get - clean up the system
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
man apt-get

# 2.2.2. Basic package management operations with the commandline
https://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/debian-reference/ch02.en.html#_basic_package_management_operations_with_the_commandline

sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
sudo apt-get clean  – clean clears out the local repository of retrieved package files. It removes everything but the lock file from /var/cache/apt/archives/ and /var/cache/apt/archives/partial/.
sudo apt-get autoclean  – Like clean, autoclean clears out the local repository of retrieved package files. The difference is that it only removes package files that can no longer be downloaded, and are largely useless.
sudo apt-get autoremove  – autoremove is used to remove packages that were automatically installed to satisfy dependencies for other packages and are now no longer needed.
sudo apt-get remove
sudo apt-get --purge remove
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get upgrade
sudo apt-get safe-upgrade
sudo apt-get install -f



If you have the version number, or the target release, apt-get supports choosing a particular version or target release. More details can be found on manual page of apt-get. It can also be accessed from terminal by typing man apt-get

sudo apt-get install <package-name>=<package-version-number> OR

sudo apt-get -t=<target release> install <package-name>

is the command to be run. This can be used to down-grade a package to a specific version.

It has been helpfully pointed out in the comments that

    apt-cache showpkg <package-name> lists all available versions. (h/t Sparhawk)
    apt-mark hold <package-name> "holds" the package at the current version, preventing automatic upgrades. (h/t Luís de Sousa )


sudo apt-cache showpkg <package-name>
sudo apt-mark hold <package-name>






Back to Top...

#    apt-get - apt-cache - apt-show-versions - aptitude - aptget
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo apt-cache policy wine
sudo apt-cache rdepends wine
sudo apt-show-versions wine

apt-cache policy skype
apt-cache rdepends skype
apt-show-versions skype
killall -9 skype
killall -9 seamonkey

apt-cache policy prosody
apt-cache rdepends prosody
apt-show-versions prosody

apt-cache policy dovecot
apt-cache rdepends skype
apt-show-versions skype
killall -9 skype

apt-cache policy nginx
apt-cache rdepends nginx
apt-show-versions nginx


apt-cache policy ntfs-3g ntfsprogs
apt-cache policy rar

apt-cache rdepends libtevent0
apt-cache rdepends packagename


# downgrade package to i386 architecture
apt-get install libtevent0/wheezy


aptitude show bootlogd
aptitude show htop
aptitude show
aptitude show


apt-show-versions
apt-show-versions htop

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    Debian Backports Jessie how to install from Backports
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list
########################################################################
# Backports repository Debian 8 Jessie
deb http://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian jessie-backports main contrib non-free
########################################################################

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-cache policy mpd
sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install mpd




Back to Top...
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    Debian SID / Unstable how to install from SID / Unstable - DON'T DO IT!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list
########################################################################
# SID
deb http://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian/ sid main non-free contrib
########################################################################

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-cache policy mpd
sudo apt-get -t sid install mpd

#    Private network
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Private_network


RFC1918 name     IP address range                 number of addresses     largest CIDR block (subnet mask)     host id size     mask bits     classful description[Note 1]
24-bit block     10.0.0.0 - 10.255.255.255         16,777,216                 10.0.0.0/8 (255.0.0.0)                 24 bits         8 bits         single class A network
20-bit block     172.16.0.0 - 172.31.255.255     1,048,576                 172.16.0.0/12 (255.240.0.0)         20 bits         12 bits     16 contiguous class B networks
16-bit block     192.168.0.0 - 192.168.255.255     65,536                     192.168.0.0/16 (255.255.0.0)         16 bits         16 bits     256 contiguous class C networks

#Get the ISO

# Check Tails signing key against the Debian keyring
https://tails.boum.org/doc/get/trusting_tails_signing_key/index.en.html
sudo apt-get install debian-keyring
gpg --keyid-format long --list-sigs A490D0F4D311A4153E2BB7CADBB802B258ACD84F

gpg --keyring=/usr/share/keyrings/debian-keyring.gpg --list-key 9C31503C6D866396




# Verify the ISO image using the command line
https://tails.boum.org/doc/get/verify_the_iso_image_using_the_command_line/index.en.html

wget https://tails.boum.org/tails-signing.key
gpg --keyid-format long --import tails-signing.key
wget https://tails.boum.org/torrents/files/tails-i386-2.2.1.iso.sig
gpg --keyid-format 0xlong --verify tails-i386-2.2.1.iso.sig tails-i386-2.2.1.iso






# Install an intermediary Tails using the command line
https://tails.boum.org/install/linux/usb/index.en.html

dd if=[tails.iso] of=[device] bs=16M && sync
dd if='/home/amnesia/tails-2.0.iso' of=/dev/sdc bs=16M && sync









In Debian 8 (Jessie), Ubuntu 15.04 (Vivid), or later, to install the necessary packages, you can execute the following commands:
sudo apt install seahorse-nautilus
wget https://tails.boum.org/tails-signing.key

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#    NOTES
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.cyberciti.biz/tips/linux-investigate-sockets-network-connections.html

# Display Sockets Summary
ss -s
# Display All Open Network Ports
ss -l
# To see process named using open socket:
ss -pl
# Find out who is responsible for opening socket / port # 4949:
ss -lp | grep 4949
#  Display All TCP Sockets
ss -t -a
# Display All UDP Sockets
ss -u -a
# Display All RAW Sockets
ss -w -a
# Display All UNIX Sockets
ss -x -a
# Display All Established SMTP Connections
ss -o state established '( dport = :smtp or sport = :smtp )'
# Display All Established HTTP Connections
ss -o state established '( dport = :http or sport = :http )'
# Find All Local Processes Connected To X Server
ss -x src /tmp/.X11-unix/*
# IPv4 All Open Network Ports/Processes names usig open sockets
ss -4nlp

# How Do I Filter Sockets Using TCP States?
## tcp ipv4 ##
ss -4 state FILTER-NAME-HERE
ss -4 state connected
ss -4 state established
 
## tcp ipv6 ##
ss -6 state FILTER-NAME-HERE

established
syn-sent
syn-recv
fin-wait-1
fin-wait-2
time-wait
closed
close-wait
last-ack
listen
closing
all : All of the above states
connected : All the states except for listen and closed
synchronized : All the connected states except for syn-sent
bucket : Show states, which are maintained as minisockets, i.e. time-wait and syn-recv.
big : Opposite to bucket state.




# History
history
cat ~/.bash_history

#    BitTorrent CLI clinet - Transmission-cli
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.unixmen.com/top-10-command-line-tools-downloading-linux/


# To install
sudo apt-get install transmission-cli transmission-daemon transmission-common screen

# Download *.torrent file
curl -O https://downloads.raspberrypi.org/raspbian_latest.torrent
cat raspbian_latest.torrent
curl -O http://downloads.raspberrypi.org/raspbian/images/raspbian-2016-05-13/2016-05-10-raspbian-jessie.zip.torrent

# See some available options
transmission-cli -h

# Download the file using transmission-cli
transmission-cli -p 25000 -er 2016-05-10-raspbian-jessie.zip.torrent


# Download the file using screen / transmission-cli
screen -a /usr/bin/transmission-cli -p 25000 -er 2016-05-10-raspbian-jessie.zip.torrent

#    Torrent_Sites - Torrent Search Engine - torrentsearch - magnetserch
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://torrentfreak.com/top-10-most-popular-torrent-sites-of-2016-160102/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BitTorrent_vocabulary



http://extratorrent.cc/
http://rarbg.to/
http://1337x.to/
http://yts.ag/
http://torrentdownloads.me/

# What Are Magnet Links, and How Do I Use Them to Download Torrents?
http://lifehacker.com/5875899/what-are-magnet-links-and-how-do-i-use-them-to-download-torrents

http://thepiratebay.se/



S | SE | Seeders | Seeding refers to leaving a peer's BitTorrent client open and available for additional individuals to download from.
Normally, a peer should seed more data than download. However, whether to seed or not, or how much to seed, depends on the availability
of downloaders and the choice of the peer at the seeding end.


L | LE | Leechers | Leecher is synonymous with downloader (see above): simply describing a peer or any client that does not have 100% of the data.


Distributed Hash Table - DHT
is used to find the IP addresses of peers, mostly in addition to a tracker.  DHT's function is to find peers who are
downloading the same files, but without communicating with a central BitTorrent tracker.


Peer Exchange - PEX
is yet another means of finding IP addresses. Rather than acting like a tracker, it leverages the knowledge of peers you are connected to,
by asking them in turn for the addresses of peers they are connected to. Although it requires a "kick start", PEX will often uncover
more genuine peers than DHT or a tracker.


Magnet links
A magnet link does away with the middleman. It's essentially a hyperlink containing the hash code for that torrent, which your torrent
client can immediately use to start finding people sharing those files.  Magnet links don't require a tracker (since it uses DHT) nor does
it require you to download a separate file before starting the download, which is convenient.

Traditionally, .torrent files are downloaded from torrent sites. A torrent client then calculates a torrent hash (a kind of fingerprint)
based on the files it relates to, and seeks the addresses of peers from a tracker (or the DHT network) before connecting to those peers
and downloading the desired content.



# BitTorrent’s Future: DHT, PEX, and Magnet Links Explained
http://lifehacker.com/5411311/bittorrents-future-dht-pex-and-magnet-links-explained




http://takeovertheworld.org/matrix/
