# File System for Data Storage Capacity
https://www.sdcard.org/consumers/choices/file_system/index.html


Update for Windows 7 (KB976422) - Install this update to support Secure Digital (SD) cards that are larger than 32 GB.
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=4247
Update for Windows 7 for x64-based Systems (KB976422) - Install this update to support Secure Digital (SD) cards that are larger than 32 GB.
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=7154
https://www.sdcard.org/downloads/formatter_4/index.html

https://download.microsoft.com/download/8/F/C/8FC5A9FE-2296-4053-A5FD-F57B3C3B70EE/Windows6.1-KB976422-x86.msu
https://download.microsoft.com/download/4/5/3/45350E25-C7B3-4C2F-BE77-D80D92A93A8B/Windows6.1-KB976422-x64.msu
https://www.sdcard.org/downloads/formatter_4/eula_windows/SDFormatterv4.zip



http://elinux.org/RPi_SD_cards

cd /sys/class/mmc_host/mmc?/mmc?:*
echo "man:$(cat manfid) oem:$(cat oemid) name:$(cat name) hwrev:$(cat hwrev) fwrev:$(cat fwrev)"




SanDisk Extreme PRO microSDXC UHS-II = SDSQXPJ-128G Price: $209.80 & FREE Shipping
SanDisk Extreme PLUS microSD UHS-I = SDSQXWG-128G
SanDisk Extreme microSD UHS-I = SDSQXWG-128G / SDSQXVF-128G
SanDisk Ultra PLUS microSD UHS-I
SanDisk Ultra microSD UHS-I



Speed Class:
Class 2    Standard video
Class 4    HD Video
Class 6    Full HD Video
Class 10    Full HD Video
UHS Speed Class 1 (U1)    Full HD Video. Supports real time video recording.
UHS Speed Class 3 (U3)    Full HD and 4K Video. Supports real time video recording.


Standard video = 720 x 480 pixels
HD Video = 1,280 x 720 pixels x 30fps for 720p
2K / Full HD Video = 1,920 x 1,080 pixels x 30fps for 1080p
4K/UHD = 3,840 pixels wide and 2,160 pixels high, making it the equivalent of two 1080p
8K/UHD = 7680 × 4320 pixels


https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/4K_resolution
Format    Resolution    Display aspect ratio    Pixels
Ultra-high-definition television    3840 × 2160    1.78:1 (16:9)    8,294,400
Ultra-wide-television    5120 × 2160    2.37:1 (21:9)    11,059,200
DCI 4K (native resolution)    4096 × 2160    1.90:1 (256:135)    8,847,360
DCI 4K (CinemaScope cropped)    4096 × 1716    2.39:1    7,028,736
DCI 4K (flat cropped)    3996 × 2160    1.85:1    8,631,360

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/8K_resolution
Resolution    Display aspect ratio    Megapixels
10240 × 4320    2.33:1 (64:27)    44.2
8192 × 4320    1.89:1 (17:9)    35.4
7680 × 4320    1.78:1 (16:9)    33.2
8192 × 5120    1.60:1 (16:10)    41.9
8192 × 8192    1.00:1 (1:1)    67.1

UHS Speed Class:
UHS Speed Class 1 designates the performance option designed to support real-time video recording with a UHS-enabled host device.
UHS Speed Class 3 designates the performance option designed to support real-time video recording with a UHS-enabled host device.


UHS-l = theoretical data transfer speeds of up to 104MB/s, four times faster than the previous possible transfer speed of 25MB/s.
UHS-ll = maximum bus interface speeds up to 312MB/s.

#    Detecting fake flash memory - Fight Flash Fraud - F3 - FFF
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Fighting flash fraud on Ebay
https://fightflashfraud.wordpress.com/download-h2testw-free-and-test-flash-memory/





Windows: H2testw / H2test
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.heise.de/download/product/h2testw-50539/download
http://www.heise.de/download/product/h2testw-50539
h2testw_1.4.zip     218.129     11.02.08     Windows XP, Windows XP 64: Integritätstest für USB-Sticks und andere Datenträger "Geschreddert statt gespeichert" c't 1/08, S. 24

http://www.heise.de/download/product/h2test-19574/download
http://www.heise.de/download/product/h2test-19574




Linux: Fight Flash Fraud = F3
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
F3 - an alternative to h2testw
http://oss.digirati.com.br/f3/


cd ~/git/f3
./f3write.h2w /media/donald/5EBD-5C80/


# Install dependencies
sudo apt-get install libudev1 libudev-dev libparted0-dev

cd ~/git
git clone https://github.com/AltraMayor/f3.git
cd f3
# Compile stable software on Linux, Windows/Cygwin, and FreeBSD
make
# If you want to install f3write and f3read, run the following command:
make install


./f3write -V
./f3write --help
./f3write --usage

# Script to create files exactly like H2testw.
cd ~/git/f3
./f3write.h2w
./f3write.h2w /media/donald/5EBD-5C80/

./f3write /media/donald/5EBD-5C80/
./f3read /media/donald/5EBD-5C80/


# Script that runs f3write and f3read, and records their output into a log file.
cd ~/git/f3
./log-f3wr --help
./log-f3wr log-filename /media/donald/5EBD-5C80/


# The extra applications for Linux  - f3probe, f3brew, and f3fix
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cd ~/git
git clone https://github.com/AltraMayor/f3.git
cd f3

# Compile the extra applications - f3probe, f3brew, and f3fix
make install-extra

#To install the extra applications, run the following command:
make install-extra


cd ~/git/f3





# F3 QT is a Linux GUI that uses QT. F3 QT supports f3write, f3read, and f3probe. Author: Tianze.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://github.com/zwpwjwtz/f3-qt
https://github.com/zwpwjwtz/f3-qt/blob/master/INSTALL

There are 2 ways to build from source QtCreator or qmake:

1A) Using QtCreator:
- Download and install the latest version of QtCreator;
- Open "f3-qt.pro" with QtCreator;
- Compile the project.


1B) Using qmake:
[-] Download and install qmake. There might be other dependencies needed for qmake. For example, under Ubuntu you can:
sudo apt-get install g++
sudo apt-get install qt5-default


[-] Switch to the source directory and run qmake:
cd ~/git
git clone https://github.com/zwpwjwtz/f3-qt.git
cd f3-qt
qmake



[-] Actually build the project:
make



4) The built executable "f3-qt" can be launched directly without further configuration of environmental variables:
./f3-qt

cd ~/git/f3-qt
./f3-qt

Ultra HD service requires the TV to support HDCP2.2 content protection and a picture resolution of 2160p50 (sometimes known as 50Hz) over the same HDMI port.

#    VoIP - SIP
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

https://teamhelp.sipgate.co.uk/hc/en-gb/articles/204125262-General-Configuration-Settings-for-IP-Deskphones-and-Softphones
Domain/Realm: sipgate.co.uk
SIP Proxy: sipgate.co.uk
Outbound Proxy: proxy.live.sipgate.co.uk
Register Expire Time: 600 Seconds
Username: your SIPID
Authorisation your SIPID
SIP-Password: your SIP Password
DTMF Method: RFC2833
STUN-Server: stun.sipgate.net
STUN-Port: 3478


# What is sipgate's STUN Server?
http://basichelp.sipgate.co.uk/hc/en-gb/articles/204153002-What-is-sipgate-s-STUN-Server-
stun.sipgate.net:3478






------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#   PJSIP -
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.pjsip.org/
https://trac.pjsip.org/repos/wiki/Getting-Started/Autoconf


# SIP-Client for Raspberry Pi that works from command line?
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/29435648/sip-client-for-raspberry-pi-that-works-from-command-line
# Raspberry Pi Caller and Answering Machine
http://binerry.de/post/29180946733/raspberry-pi-caller-and-answering-machine
# PJSIP Raspberry Pi I2S
https://www.raspberrypi.org/forums/viewtopic.php?f=44&t=73645&p=532692


# Install dependencies
sudo apt-get install build-essential automake autoconf libtool libasound2-dev libssl-dev libsamplerate0-dev libcommoncpp2-dev libccrtp-dev libzrtpcpp-dev libdbus-1-dev libdbus-c++-dev libyaml-dev libpcre3-dev libgsm1-dev libspeex-dev libspeexdsp-dev libpulse0 libpulse-mainloop-glib0

# NOT WORKING
sudo apt-get install build-essential automake autoconf libtool libasound2-dev libpulse-dev libssl-dev libsamplerate0-dev libcommoncpp2-dev libccrtp-dev libzrtpcpp-dev libdbus-1-dev libdbus-c++-dev libyaml-dev libpcre3-dev libgsm1-dev libspeex-dev libspeexdsp-dev




# Install from source code
cd ~/Install
wget http://www.pjsip.org/release/2.5.5/pjproject-2.5.5.tar.bz2
tar -jxvf pjproject-2.5.5.tar.bz2
cd pjproject-2.5.5/
./configure && make dep && make clean && make

# Test
cd pjsip-apps/bin

./pjsua-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

# To install
sudo make install



./configure --enable-static      # add options if needed, e.g: optimization, install dir, search path
make && make install-lib-static  # default install dir is /usr/local








# Install with Subversion
sudo apt-get install subversion -y
svn help
# Create SVN folder
mkdir ~/svn;cd svn
#
svn checkout http://svn.pjsip.org/repos/pjproject/trunk
#
cd trunk
#
./configure && make dep && make clean && make && make install

................
sudo apt-get install libsdl1.2-dev
sudo apt-get install libpt-dev
sudo apt-get install libopal-dev

#    JPcap - SIP Inspector
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.sipinspector.com/download/jpcap



# SIP Inspector - COMMERCIAL PAID FOR SOFTWARE!
cd ~/Install
wget https://554820f6-a-62cb3a1a-s-sites.googlegroups.com/site/sipinspectorsite/SIPInspectorDeluxe_5.36_OS.zip
unzip SIPInspectorDeluxe_5.36_OS.zip -d SIPInspectorDeluxe_5.36
cd SIPInspectorDeluxe_5.36
./SIPInspDlx



# JPcap - Install using Debian package - NEEDS sun-java6-jdk - NOT WORKING!
cd ~/Install
wget https://554820f6-a-62cb3a1a-s-sites.googlegroups.com/site/sipinspectorsite/download/jpcap/jpcap-0.7.deb
# Lets get some info on the package
sudo dpkg --info jpcap-0.7.deb
# Look inside
sudo dpkg -c jpcap-0.7.deb
# Install
sudo dpkg -i jpcap-0.7.deb
# Correct all dependencies

sun-java6-jdk


JavaPackage
https://wiki.debian.org/JavaPackage
java-package (0.56) https://packages.debian.org/jessie/java-package Utility for creating Java Debian packages


# Update the list of available packages and install the "java-package" package:
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install java-package

# Download the desired Java JDK/JRE binary distribution (Oracle). Choose tar.gz archives or self-extracting archives, do not choose the RPM!
JDK - Java SE Development Kit
JRE - Java SE Runtime Environment




# Install dependencies  Java 6 From jdk-6u45-linux-x64.bin:
sudo apt-get install libgl1-mesa-glx libfontconfig1 libxslt1.1 libxtst6 libxxf86vm1 libgtk2.0-0
# Install dependencies  Java 6 From jdk-6u45-linux-x64.bin:
sudo apt-get install libgl1-mesa-glx libgtk2.0-0 libxslt1.1 libxtst6 libxxf86vm1 libxt6


cd ~/Install
# Get the i386 / x86 version if you have 32bit OS
wget http://download.oracle.com/otn-pub/java/jdk/8u102-b14/jdk-8u102-linux-i586.tar.gz
make-jpkg jdk-8u102-linux-i586.tar.gz
# Get the amd64 / x64 version if you have 64bit OS
wget http://download.oracle.com/otn-pub/java/jdk/8u102-b14/jdk-8u102-linux-x64.tar.gz
make-jpkg jdk-8u102-linux-x64.tar.gz
sudo dpkg -i oracle-java8-jdk_8u102_amd64.deb


sudo update-alternatives --auto java
sudo update-alternatives --display java
sudo update-alternatives --config java

sudo update-java-alternatives -l
sudo update-java-alternatives -s jdk-8-oracle-x64





# JPcap - Install from Source build - NEEDS sun-java6-jdk - NOT WORKING!
https://packages.debian.org/jessie-backports/openjdk-8-jdk
https://packages.debian.org/jessie-backports/openjdk-8-jre

sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install openjdk-8-jdk

sudo update-alternatives --display java

/usr/lib/jvm/java-8-openjdk-amd64/bin/jstack
/usr/bin/jstack


cd ~/Install
wget https://554820f6-a-62cb3a1a-s-sites.googlegroups.com/site/sipinspectorsite/download/jpcap/jpcap-0.7.tar.gz
tar -xvzf jpcap-0.7.tar.gz
cd jpcap-0.7/src/c
make
cp libjpcap.so /jre/lib/i386
or if Java 6
cp libjpcap.so /usr/java/packages/lib/ext

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cs708l_EgrY
